She sells for cash from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm and fills orders for neighbors, other companies who place orders with her, and small businesses from the sector.
Her suppliers offer her discounts if she buys her supplies, such as wheat flower, in bulk.  She passes her saving onto her customers and keeps them happy so that they will return to buy more.  She is asking for a Kiva loan, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy wheat flour, and dessert-making supplies.  Since November she has been taking orders from families who want to celebrate Christmas and New Year with sandwiches, pastries, and desserts.  María wants to be able to fill these orders with the products she makes with her own hands and tickle the taste buds of those who buy them and share her love of delicious puddings, desserts, etc. over these lovely December festivities and traditions. During this time her number of customers and income will increase.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es: Carlos Ernesto de treinta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Él se posee un taller de estructuras metálicas donde elabora, balcones para ventana, puertas entre otros, tiene varios años con su trabajo y eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, ya tiene mucha clientela, pues la materia prima q utiliza es de primera calidad, los precios por estructura muy accesibles y además con un servicio excelente, sus compradores siempre quedan satisfechos; Carlos es un hombre honrado y muy trabajador, con muchos propósitos a futuro, piensa que para  tener éxito, debes trabajar arduamente, el cree en su sueño de hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hierro por mayor. Carlos Ernesto tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos Ernesto is 35 years old and lives with his life partner and children in a home of his own.  He has a metal shop where he makes window sills, doors, and other things and has done so for several years.  This has provided him with valuable experience which allows him to earn a greater income.  He has many customers because he uses high quality materials, has good prices, and provides excellent service.  His customers are always satisfied.

Carlos is an honest, hardworking man with many plans for the future.  He believes that one must work hard to have good prospects for the future and has a desire to grow his business.  He has requested a loan through INTEGRAL so he can buy iron in quantity.  Carlos Ernesto comes with good payment references, is certain that he can get out of debt, and believes that he will also be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy iron.

loans.name: Stallin

texts.es: Stallin, tiene la edad  de 27 años, está casado,  vive con la esposa  actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar una motocicleta para transportarse al trabajo. El tiene pensado comprar el vehículo para poder seguir en el trabajo ya que tiene que viajar  muchos kilómetros de la casa al trabajo y las rutas de los buses son muy escasas por lo que se le hace muy difícil transportarse. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Stallin is 27 years old, married, and lives with his wife.  He will use the money from this loan to buy a motorcycle to ride to work.  He plans to buy a vehicle to be able to continue working, now that he has to travel many kilometers from home.  The bus routes are scarce and it makes travel difficult.  This will be his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any previous loans through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with great ease and at much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.es:
Melvin es un joven de 25 años de edad,  es agricultor desde muy temprana edad  y vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en  una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica. Melvin tiene esta actividad agrícola como única fuente de ingreso para mantener a su familia, sus hijos aún son muy pequeños por lo tanto él piensa en darles una excelente calidad de vida y una buena educación académica.

El necesita un préstamo de ₡300.000 (trescientos mil colones), para comprar semilla de maíz y suministros para atender el proyecto hasta cosechar el producto. El destaca que su objetivo es aumentar sus ingresos económicos por medio de esta actividad agrícola. Este es su segundo préstamo y manifiesta estar muy agradecido porque con el anterior financiamiento pudo sembrar en un terreno más grande y obtuvo mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Melvin is a 25 year old young man.  He has been a farmer from a very early age, and lives with his wife and two daughters in a southern Costa Rican community.  Farming is Melvin’s only source of income for supporting his family.  His children are very young and therefore plans to give them an excellent quality of life and a good education.

He needs a loan of 3,000 Colones to buy corn seed, and supplies to attend to his project and harvest his product.  He says that his objective is to increase his income through his farming.  This will be his second loan and he says that he is very grateful because the previous loan made it possible to plant on a larger piece of land and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es: José Francisco tiene 27 años de edad, es padre de familia, y depende de la agrícultura para obtener sus ingresos económicos, se ha dedicado desde muy jóven a la siembra de maíz por lo que conoce bien el proceso de desarrollo y cosecha de este producto. Está solicitando un préstamo de doscientos cincuenta mil colones exactos (¢250.000) para compra de semilla de maíz e insumos agrícolas, manifiesta su agradecimiento por la oportunidad de financiamiento que le brindan las empresas de apoyo comunal
texts.en: José Francisco is 27 years old, is a father, and depends on agriculture to earn an income.  He has been raising corn since he was very young and knows the development and harvest of this crop very well.  He is asking for a loan of 250,000 Colones so that he can buy corn seed and farming supplies.  He says that he is grateful for the opportunity of this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly tiene 26 años de edad  y es la propietaria de una peluquera en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su experiencia data  de hace 10 años, cuando aprendió haciendo cortes y peinados de cabellos para damas y caballeros. Ella tambien se dedica a la venta de productos afines a su negocio, como articulos de belleza, productos para hacer  manicures y  pedicures. Kelly aprendió ser peluquera porque es una tradicion de su familia – su madre se dedica tambien a la misma actividad y la enseñó en su juventud. Después, Kelly hizo cursos para mejorar su conocimiento y perfeccionar su aptitud. Su negocio lo trabaja desde la casa de otro peluquero, y compra a   varios laboratorios de belleza. Su sueño para el futuro de su negocio es tener un lugar propio para ofrecer sus servicio y tener una distribuidora de los productos de belleza, para eso trabaja porque su máximo anhelo  es tener tener una casa propia, donde puede vivir con su cónyugue e hijo de 5 años, y adecuar en las mejores condiciones de calidad su propio salón de belleza. Sus desafíos mas grandes es organizar efectivamente su negocio y disminuir los gastos que este le genera. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mas productos de belleza para comercializarlos y como parte de su inventario de  insumos para el uso en su negocio; con esta inversión en mayor volumen, disminuíra los costos y planea ahorrar un poco mas, para cumplir su sueño lo mas pronto posible.
texts.en: Kelly is 26 years old and has a hair salon in Barranquilla.  It has been 10 years since she learned to do cuts and styles for men and women.  She also sells products related to her business, such as beauty products, to do manicures and pedicures.  Kelly learned styling because it was a family tradition.  Her mother does the same thing and taught her when she was little.  Later Kelly took courses to improve her skills and perfect her aptitude.  She works another stylist’s home and buys her supplies from a beauty lab.  Her dream for the future of her business is to have a place of her own to offer her services and have a distributorship for her beauty products.  She works because her greatest desire is to have a home of her own, where she can live with her husband and five year old son and set up her own beauty salon.  Her greatest challenges are setting up an effective business and reduce the cost that it requires.  She is asking for a Kiva loan and this will be her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which will allow her to buy supplies in quantity for her business.  This will reduce her costs and she plans to save a bit more in order to achieve her dream as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona con valores muy acentuados por sus padres, la honradez, la humildad, el respeto y el trabajo son cualidades que la definen muy bien, siendo un ejemplo para sus 3 hijos que la quieren y la respetan.

El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se lo invertirá en la compra de tela e hilos para la realización de bordados artesanales en tela, este es un trabajo de sacrificio pero que lo hace con mucho amor, sabiendo que cada día puede llevar alimento a su casa.

El sueño que Doña María tiene es exportar a otros países sus bordados artesanales en prendas de vestir, María  está segura que con trabajo lo va a lograr, y con estos ingresos darles la educación a sus hijos que todavía dependen de ella.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman of great values given to her by her parents, such as honesty, humility, and respect for work, with which she is defined well.  She is an example for her three children who love and respect her.

She is asking for a loan through Fodemi and will use the money to buy fabric and thread to make artistic embroideries in cloth.  This is very demanding work and she does it with lots of love, knowing that each day she can bring home the bacon.

Maria’s dream is to export her embroideries in clothing to other nations.  Maria is certain that she will achieve it through her work and with this income be able to provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es:
Con 41 años de edad Yuri es un gran emprendedor de su localidad, comparte un matrimonio con Erlinda de 37 años y como principal motivación de vida esta su hija Shirley de 21 años a quien brindó todo el apoyo para lograr hoy verla desempeñando una carrera universitaria. Es propietario de una vivienda de material noble. Odontólogo de profesión, pero emprendedor de vocación decidió complementar inicialmente su pequeño laboratorio dental con una tienda en el que expende diversos artículos, entre ellos accesorios para celulares, artículos para el hogar y demás en general. Gracias a este pequeño giro ha logrado incrementar sus ingresos para forjarse así como un pequeño micro-empresario, por otro lado como apoyo sólido a la economía familiar esta su esposa quien a su vez es propietaria de un pequeño puesto de ropa haciendo así de esta familia un gran ejemplo de trabajo y esfuerzo.
Para seguir trabajando con la fluidez que lo caracteriza, desea contar con capital adicional para la compra de cargadores de celulares de las diversas marcas y modelos, puesto que son un producto que cada día posee una gran demanda, entre sus principales clientes están las personas cuya labor esta dirigida al campo y es los fines de semana que gracias a su concurrencia obtiene buenas ganancias a diferencia de otros días particulares.
A futuro desea consolidar su negocio con el de su esposa y lograr formar un pequeño centro comercial en su localidad con el objetivo y también darles oportunidad a otros comerciantes menores del rubro. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se siente motivado y a la vez agradecido por la oportunidad y confianza brindada comprometiéndose en ser un socio muy participativo para con su banco comunal.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra cargadores de las distintas marcas y modelos para así aprovechar la constante demanda que estos productos poseen.
texts.en:
At 54 years of age, Yuri is a great entrepreneur.  He is married to 37 year old Erlinda.  His 21 year old daughter Shirley, to whom he gave all his support and was able to see her working on a university career, is his main motivation for living.  He owns his home, which is made out of sturdy materials.  A dentist by profession, but an entrepreneur by vocation, he decided to complement his dental lab with a store for different articles, such as cell phone accessories, articles for the home, and other general merchandise.  Thanks to this little addition, he was able to increase his income and set himself up as a small business owner.  It also provides for the family’s financial stability.  His wife is also the owner of a small clothing stall.  This family is an example of hard work and effort.

I order to continue to work with the fluidity that characterizes him; he wants to have additional capital to buy cellular chargers of different brands and models, because this item is in demand.  His main customers include people who work in the fields and on the weekends.  Thanks to his concurrent business, he has good earnings as opposed to other particular days.

In the future he wants to consolidate his business with that of his wife’s and set up a small shopping center in his neighborhood.  He also wants to provide opportunities to other small merchants.  This will be his first loan through MFP and he is motivated and grateful for the opportunity and trust as a member of his communal bank.  He will use the 1,000 PEN to buy chargers to be able to take advantage of the demand.

loans.use: to buy cell phone chargers

loans.name: Dina Lizeth

texts.es:
Dina, 26 años de edad, originaria de la Comarca la flecha, Teustepe, casada, tiene  1 hijo de 3 años, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante. Inicio con capital propio, dinero que ganaba  como domesticas, también con dinero que   le daba  su marido quien trabaja como cobrador de un bus, la  cual tiene 8 años de realizar este negocio.

Dina solicita el financiamiento para comprar  toda la mercadería  en general tales como  pantalones, vestidos, blusas, zapatos, etc.  Ya que  ella estima que este crédito le ayudaría  a  incrementar su mercadería que más se vende. Sus  planes futuros es  solicitar otro préstamo para seguir ampliando su negocio, de esta manera obtener mejores  ganancias. Su meta  próxima es  agregar más mercadería que aun no tiene en  existencia, para seguir creciendo en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Dina is 26 years old and from the Teustepe settlement.  She is married, has a three year old son, and sells clothing on foot.  She has had her business for eight years and began with money she saved up when she worked as domestic help and money that her husband gave her.  He worked as a bus fare taker.

Dina is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as pants, dresses, shoes, etc.  She estimates that this loan will help her increase her inventory of what she sells the most.  Her plans for the future are to request another loan to continue expanding her business and in this way increase her profit.  Her next goal is to add merchandise that she currently doesn’t have so that she can continue to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six, Linda works hard to support her family.

She has a resto bar (bar-restaurant) business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.  Linda is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her resto bar business.

Linda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her bar-restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance on the motorcyle he uses in hs business.

loans.name: 01.07.05 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Liên is 49 years old and is married with two children who are dependents.

Liên is the group leader of the 01.07.05 solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in the city of Thanh Hoa, an urban area in the province of Thanh Hoa. 

In 2004, Liên joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid four loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Liên has been involved in this business for eight years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

Liên hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Абдумалику 27 лет. Он женат, но не имеет детей. Его жена Биойша швея, и шьёт красивые женские национальные платья. Абдумалик после окончания средней школы начал работать, то есть советом родителей он начал предпринимательскую деятельность. Уже более 4 года он занимается купле продажей автомашин. Он покупает старые машины, ремонтирует их и перепродает по более высоким ценам и таким образом получает доход. Полученный доход он использует для содержания семьи. Его семья довольно им, однако все его деньги уходят на расходы семьи, и он не может сделать сбережения. Скоро у них в семье мероприятие и к ним придут много гостей. У Абдумалика нет денег для покупки продуктов, чтобы накрыть праздничный стол и рассчитаться другими организационными расходами. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для проведения мероприятия. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abdumalik is 27 years old and married, but they have no children.  His wife, Bioysha, is a seamstress and sews beautiful traditional women's dresses.  After finishing high school, at his parents' advice Abdumalik began work at his own business.  For more than four years now he has been trading in cars.  He buys old ones, repairs them and resells them for a higher price, thus earning a profit.  He uses the income to support his family.  They are pleased with him, however all his money goes out on the family's expenses and he can't save any.  Soon the family is to have a large party with many guests.  Abdulmalik doesn't have the money for buying goods for the holiday table or to meet the other expenses of organizing the party.  He is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni for throwing the party.  He is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to throw a party

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her store. Her earnings were a big help in paying for her personal, household and business expenditures. 

Marilou would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profits. Her profits from the business will help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilou hopes to have a peaceful life and dreams for a good life for her child. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

Note: All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her general store business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials for a paper-making business.

loans.name: 02.06.02 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai has a service business repairing phones. She is requesting a loan to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell.

Mai is 35 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 02.06.02 Đông Hải solidarity group. Mai lives with two dependents in the city of Thanh Hoa, an urban town in the province of Thanh Hoa.

In 2008, Mai joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Mai has successfully repaid four loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Mai has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

Mai hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make souvenir items.

loans.name: Abdulkaream

texts.en: Abdulkaream is a 49-year-old married man with 6 children who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a hardworking man who works as a teacher. He applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture for his house. He hopes to improve his living conditions and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 56 years old and married with 10 children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Lucia has been buying and selling livestock for 13 years; she earns additional income from operating a rice mill.

She works tirelessly to the attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.fr: Marie est une camerounaise de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle possède et gère une mini boutique de vente de mèche et de produits de beauté dans un quartier de la ville depuis 8 mois. durand cette période, elle a vu grandir sa clientèle et n'arrive plus à les satisfaire convenablement. ce crédit va lui permettre d'augmenter son stock de marchandises en achetant des mèches et produits de beauté afin d'augmenter ses ventes, voir son profit. les profits générés vont lui permettre d'augmenter son capital, accroître son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, nutrition)
texts.en: Marie is a Cameroonian woman who is 28 years old, married and mother to three children. She has owned and managed a small shop in one of the town's districts, selling hair extensions and beauty products, for the past eight months, and during this period she has seen her customer base grow and is unable to manage to satisfy customer demand sufficiently. This loan will enable her to increase her stock, by buying hair extensions and beauty products, so that she can increase her sales and profits. The profits she makes will enable her to increase her capital, expand her business and provide for her family's needs (education, food).

loans.use: to buy goods.

loans.name: Mamadou Diop

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou Diop est un homme marié qui vit au Sénégal.  Il évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le secteur du service. C’est un employé municipal chargé du courrier au sein d’une mairie d’une  localité sénégalaise.  Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour la réfection de la dalle de sa maison.  Les revenus qui lui procure son activité  lui permettent de supporter les charges quotidiennes de sa famille, il est marié et père d’un enfant de 10 ans. Son objectif consiste a améliorer le cadre de vie de sa famille. Il souhaite disposer dans l’avenir d’un immeuble commercial.
texts.en: Mamadou Diop is a married man who lives in Senegal.  For more than ten years he has been progressing in the service sector and he is a council employee in charge of the post within the town hall of a Senegalese town. He is requesting a 100,000 francs loan so that he can repair the flagstones in his house. The income which his activity generates enables him to cover his family's daily expenses - he is married and father to a ten year old child. His aim is to improve his family's living conditions. In the future he would like to have a commercial building.

loans.use: to repair paving stones.

loans.name: Muminakhon

texts.ru: Муминахону 45 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Двое старшие дети семейные, один студент и младшему 14 лет. Ее муж разнорабочий получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Муминахон  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес услугой такси, так как она очень хорошо вводит машину. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания и купить новые технологии для детей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  15000 сомони для покупки автомашины марки Мерседес, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muminakhon is 45 years old, married, and has four children.  The two oldest are married, one of the others is a student, and the youngest is 14 years old.  Her husband is a laborer and earns a small salary.  His salary isn't enough to provide the family with all the necessities, so Muminakhon decided to help her husband for the well-being of the family.  With this goal, she studied in a course called "Achieve Success" that is organized by the Association of Business Women, and she received her graduation certificate.  

Since she is an excellent driver, Muminakhon wants to organize her own business offering taxi services.  She plans to use the income to improve their living conditions and to buy new technology for the children.  She is requesting a loan of 15,000 somoni for the purchase of a Mercedes so she can start her new business.   She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a car for organizing a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her sari-sari store

loans.name: 3.5. 210. Thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Thoa is the group leader of the 3.5. 210. Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of three members. She is 60 years old and married, with three children. Her children are grown up so she supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thoa works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  Thoa is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. This is Thoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her new profits, Thoa hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo describes herself as happy, hard-working, and responsible with her children. She has been running a general store for several years, which has given her good results. For this reason, she needs to expand it more. However, she lacks enough working capital to do so. Thanks for the previous loan that had a great positive impact on her business.

Mwanakombo has a good repayment history and she is a person who can be trusted. She is sure to repay this loan and ask for more loans in the future. This new loan will enable her to add stock of basic grains, food stuffs, basic medicines, and cleaning products.

loans.use: to add stock of basic grains, food stuffs, basic medicines, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Bayasgalan is 50 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband Baldorj runs a taxi service business. Her son Rentsenlhundev, age 11, goes to a local school. 

Bayasgalan has been working as a cobbler for a private company since 2009. She is planning to start her own cobbling business at her home. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a sewing machine for her new business as a cobbler. She is a hardworking and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her new business as a cobbler

loans.name: 3.5. 212. Thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Hương is 41 years old, married, and has three children.  She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit, which she has been doing for 10 years. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase fruit to sell. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Hương  is the group leader of the 3.5. 212. Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of three members. In 2003, Hương  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  With her profits, Hương  hopes to remodel her house, maintain a successful business, and buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Ines Rocio

texts.es:
INES ROCIO tiene 35 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de ls rìos.


Es integrante de la VRC LA VICTORIA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

INES ROCIO  se dedica a la agricultura a las siembras de maíz, arroz. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, semillas, urea, líquido mata monte, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar lo necesario para las siembras.

El sueño es incrementar las cosechas para este nuevo año. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades, plagas en el cultivo.
En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Ines Rocio is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in the city of Ventanas, in Provincia de los rìos.

She is a member of the VRC Victoria, located in Recinto Pantano, which belongs to Cantón Ventanas. They are dedicated to agricultural and livestock work.

Ines Rocio is dedicated to the planting of corn and rice. Purchases are made in the city of Ventanas. She requests this loan to buy insecticides, seeds, urea, liquid Mata Monte (an herbicide) and fertilizers. With the help of this loan she will be able to buy the things necessary for the planting.

Her dream is to increase the harvest for the new year. The challenges facing her are disease and crop pests. In her free time, she enjoys practicing sports.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, seeds, urea, liquid Mata Monte, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Сафар житель города Исфары. Ему 50 лет. Сафар женат. Он имеет 2 детей. Сафар более семи лет работает повором. Он хорошо разбирается в национальной кухни. В 2002 году Сафар открыл свою национальную кухню, где он работает в качестве шеф повара. Сафар берет кредит для ремонта кухни и помещения. Он намерен сделать ремонт в азиатском стиле.
texts.en: Safar is a resident of the city of Isfara.  He is 50 years old, married, and has two children.  For more than seven years Safar has been working as a cook.  He is very skilled in traditional dishes.  In 2002 Safar opened his own traditional kitchen where he works as the head chef.  Safar is taking out a loan to remodel his kitchen and business space.  He plans on doing the remodel in an Asian style.

loans.use: to remodel his kitchen and business space

loans.name: Gayratchon

texts.ru: Гайратчону 27 лет. Он добропорядочный и мотивированный человек. У него много позитивных энергий и планов. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. Дети еще не совершеннолетние и учатся в средней школе. Он работает слесарем более 3 года в организации. Он имеет доход от выращивания сельхоз культур в собственном земельном участке. Он занимается выращиванием овощей. Полученный доход он использует для содержания семьи. Он хочет покупать минеральные удобрения для своего земельного участка, но не имеет достаточно денег для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки минерального удобрения. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gayratchon is 27 years old and he is a straight-arrow, motivated man.  He has many positive activities and plans.  He is married and has three children.  His wife helps him with the business.  The children are still minors and are in school.  He has been working for more than three years as a mechanic/fitter in an organization.  He also has an income from growing crops on his own piece of land.  He grows vegetables.  He uses the income that he earns to support his family.  He wants to buy mineral fertilizers for his land, but he doesn't have enough money for this.  He is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy mineral fertilizers.  He is relying on your suppport.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: 3.5.213.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Phượng is 62 years old, married, and has three children.  She raises poultry and cattle, which she has been doing for 10 years. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Phượng is the group leader of the 3.5.213.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of four members. This is Phượng first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her profits, Phượng hopes to buy land of her own, maintain a successful business, and buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas, vegetables and spices to resell

loans.name: Roque De Jesus

texts.es: Roque se encuentra muy agradecido por el apoyo recibido  de manera continua a su proyectos de inversión; con su credikiva anterior él compró,  tomates, papa, ají, cebolla, brócoli, coliflor, maracuyá y lulo, con lo que incrementó sus ventas, porque ofreció gran diversidad de frutas, verduras y tuberculos frescos a su distinguida clientela. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará artículos de la canasta familiar, especialmente frutas y verduras frescas, propias de la temporada, donde usualmente son muy utilizados, para celebrar las fiestas de fin de año en familia y por ello presentan una gran rotación en sus inventarios, que Roque debe suplir permanetemente.
texts.en:
Roque is very grateful for the continuous support he has received for his business.  With his previous Kiva loan he bought tomatoes, potatoes, chilies, onions, broccoli, cauliflower, passion fruit and lulo [a tomato-like fruit], with which he increased his sales.  He offers a wide variety of fresh fruits, vegetables and tubers to his distinguished customers.

Today he is applying for a new Kiva loan with which he will buy household staples, especially fresh fruits and vegetables that are customarily eaten by families to celebrate the holiday season.  Roque must therefore rotate his inventory from what he must supply on a permanent basis.

loans.use: to buy household staples, especially fresh fruits and vegetables that are customary in the holiday season.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 55 years old, and from a small village in the Tskaltubo district. Mzia has a large family: a husband, three sons, a daughter-in-law and a grandson. Her husband has a retirement pension. 

The family runs an agricultural business. Specifically, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Mzia milks the cows and produces cheese, and sells locally in an open market at a good price. Mzia also has two pigs and sells piglets locally. Each member of the family works hard, and does all of the agricultural work. 

Mzia has requested a loan for renovating the house.  Their house is too old, and there are 7 members of the family living in it; it needs renovation. After renovating the house, they will be able to live in better conditions in the winter. Mzia awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs.Chuluuntsetseg is 50 years old, and lives with her husband and four children in a ger in Omnogobi province of Mongolia. Her husband, Bayarsaihan, helps his wife run her business of traditional costumes and shoes (production and sales). Her 3 oldest children have graduated from the university, and stay home helping their parents. The youngest child goes to a local secondary school. 

She has been herding livestock since 2002. She has been tailoring traditional costumes by customers' orders since then. She has gained lot of experience, and has gained customers' trust over the years. 

Her sewing machine is so old and needs to be replaced. She is now requesting 2,200,000MNT to purchase an electric sewing machine and inventory to run her business smoothly. She is a honest, modest and hardworking woman.

loans.use: to purchase an electric sewing machine and inventory to run her business smoothly.

loans.name: Serafina Ludys

texts.es: Serafina, estuvo muy feliz con su anterior credikiva, pues logró tener un capital de trabajo adicional, con el que compró cervezas, calzado, ropa cosméticos y perfumería, mercancía que vendió entre sus clientes, ganando un poco mas de dinero que lo usual y ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Su credikiva ha aumentado la liquidez de su negocio, sus ventas se incrementan y su clientela solicita mas productos; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo credikiva con el que comprará  cervezas y bebidas, calzado, ropa y accesorios que sus catalogos ofrecen con precios especiales y esto gusta mucho a su clientela. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente " Muchas gracias a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, espero seguir recibiendo tan importante apoyo económico "
texts.en:
Serafina was very happy with her previous Kiva loan because she managed to have additional working capital, which bought beers, footwear, clothing, cosmetics and perfume. The merchandise sold to her customers, earning more money than usual, which she used to improve her housing conditions.

Her Kiva loan has increased the liquidity of her business, her sales, and her customers have asked for more products. For this reason, she is asking for a new Kiva loan to buy beers and drinks, footwear, clothing and accessories offered in catalogs with special pricing that her customers really like.

Her message to the people that fund Kiva is as follows, "Many thanks to Kiva and the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, I hope to continue to receive this important economic support."

loans.use: to buy beers and drinks, footwear, clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Juana Martina

texts.es:
JUANA MARTINA tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil uniòn libre tiene dos hijas, vive con el conyugue y con las hijas en la ciudad ed Ventanas Provincia de los rìos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA VICTORIA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

JUANA MARTINA  se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Las compras las realizarà en la ciudad de Ventanas. Solicita el crèdito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas.

 Con la ayuda del crédito comprar los fertilizantes. El sueños es comprarce una casa con terraza. Los desafìos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer los quehaceres domèsticos.
texts.en:
JUANA MARTINA is 40 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. She has two daughters and lives with her husband and daughters in the city of Ventanas in the Los Rios province.

She is a member of the LA VICTORIA communal bank which dedicates itself to the sectors of Agriculture and Livestock. It's located in Recinto Pantano which belongs to the Ventanas district.

JUANA MARTINA sows corn and rice. She makes purchases in the city of Ventanas. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilisers and pesticides.

With the help of the loan she will be able to buy fertilisers. Her dream is to buy a house with land. Her biggest challenges are the plagues and diseases that her crops suffer.

In her free time she likes to do domestic chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilisers, pesticides.

loans.name: Emprendiendo Paso A Paso Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Emprendiendo paso a paso” está conformado por 21 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; almacén, zapatería, tejido, venta de postres, minimarket, manualidades, venta de verduras, venta de perfumes, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillan.
Alejandra, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en segunda fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una polera de color verde oscuro, su cabello lo usa suelto y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de alimentos para mascotas desde hace 4 meses. Comenta que arrienda una casa donde contaba con un local y éste lo habilito para la venta de comida de mascotas, trabaja de lunes a sábado y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando lo compra a diferentes proveedores de la zona, donde le ofrecen una buena mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará alimentos para gatos, perros, pollo, conejo, gallinas.
Una de las metas de Alejandra es agrandar su negocio vendiendo otras cosas como muebles para el hogar, ya que su local es grande y quiere ocupar todo el local, así con esto generar mayores ingresos  y optar a una mejor calidad de vida y un buen pasar económico a su familia. 
Alejandra vive junto a sus dos hijas pequeñas de 7 y 4 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es darle lo mejor a sus hijas y un buen futuro escolar, y a nivel laboral tener más fuerzas para seguir creciendo dia a dia y lograr ser una microempresaria.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido  organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “Emprendiendo paso a paso”.  It has 21 members who work in different businesses including: running a grocery store, shoe making, knitting, selling desserts, running a mini-mart, making handicrafts, selling vegetables, selling perfumes and providing services.  All of the group's members live in the city of Chillán.

Alejandra is a member of this group.  In the photo, she is standing second from the left, in the second row.  She is wearing a dark green fleece and she has dark brown hair which is not tied back.

Alejandra has been selling pet food for four months.  She says that she rents a house with premises which she fixed up so that she could start a business selling pet food.  She works from Monday to Saturday, whenever she is available.  She buys the merchandise and supplies that she needs from different suppliers in her area who offer her good merchandise at low prices which works out well for her.

Alejandra will use her loan to buy pet food for cats, dogs, chickens, rabbits and hens.  One of her goals is to expand her business and start selling other products such as household furniture as her premises are large and she wants to use all of the space available to her.  She would also like to be able to make more income and provide her family with a better quality of life and financial security.

Alejandra lives together with her two young daughters who are 7 and 4 years old.  Her dreams for her family are to provide her daughters with the best, ensuring they receive a good education in the future.  On a business level, she would like to gain more strength so that she can continue developing on a daily basis and become a successful micro-businesswoman.

Alejandra is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza as it will allow her to invest in her business.  She says that the training sessions she has attended have been incredibly important for her business and also in terms of her own personal development as she has learned how to better organize and distribute her income and investments.  As far as her community bank is concerned, she says that the group enjoys very good communication among its members.

Chillán is a town in the central south region of Chile.  The name means 'chair of the sun' in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuche people.  Chillán is known as the 'birthplace of the nation' or 'land of artists' as it is the birthplace of some famous figures from Chilean history such as, for example, the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy pet food for cats, dogs, chickens, rabbits and hens

loans.name: Marcos Benedo

texts.es:
Marcos Benedo   tiene 31 años de edad de estado civil actual Unión Libre, vive con la pareja  y con los tres hijos. Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache Cantón Mocache.

Es integrante de la VRC EL PROGRESO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto aguas frìas de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y tamien a labores pecuarias.

Marcos Benedo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de animales. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.

El crédito solicita para la compra de semillas, urea, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para arrendar tierra para sembrar. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres paracticando el depoerte en especial el trotar.
texts.en:
Marcos Benedo is thirty-one years old and is in a common-law marriage.  He lives with his partner and with their three children.  He lives in the area of Aguas Frías de Mocache in the Mocache canton.  

He is a member of the communal bank El Progreso, which is located in the Aguas Frías de Mocache area in Mocache canton. This bank works in short-cycle agriculture growing corn, rice, and working with livestock.

Marcos Benedo makes a living in agriculture, growing corn, rice, and also raising animals.  He does the buying and selling in Ventanas.  

The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of seeds, urea, fertilizers, and manure for the crops.  The loan helped him to lease land for planting.  His dream is to have his own house.

In his free time, he likes to play sports, especially going jogging.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, and manure for the crops.

loans.name: Pilar De Jesus

texts.es:
PILAR DE JESUS tiene 26 años de edad de estado civil uniòn libre tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los rìos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA VICTORIA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

PILAR DE JESUS se dedica a la agricultura a las siembras de maíz, arroz. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata monte, fertilizantes. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podra mejorar los ingresos y con ello mejora el bienestar de la familia.
El sueño es comprarce una moto. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades, plagas en el cultivo.
En el tiempo libre le gusta limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Pilar de Jesus, 26, lives with her husband and son in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos.  She is a member of the communal bank LA VICTORIA, which is located in the Pantano Community in the Ventanas Canton, where most people work in agriculture and live-stock farming.

Pilar de Jesus grows corn and rice.  She buys supplies in the city of Ventanas and is requesting a loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, liquid weed killer and fertilizers.

With the help of the loan she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's lifestyle.

Her goal is to buy a motorcycle.  The challenges she is up against are plant disease and crop plagues.  In her free time, she enjoys house cleaning.

loans.use: To buy seeds, insecticides, urea, liquid weed killer and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru: Рустамджону 30 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его жена, Махбуба очень добрая женщина и работает в правоохранительном органе. Рустамджон более 8 лет работает в банке охранником. У него есть дополнительный доход от услуги такси. Заработанные деньги Рустамджон и его жена используют для содержания семьи. Они живут очень в старом доме, который построил отец Рустамджона. Он должен отремонтировать дом, но не имеет средства для покупки строительных материалов и оплаты услуги мастера по ремонту. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rustamjon is 30 years old, married, and has three children.  His wife, Makhbuba, is a wonderful woman who works in a law-enforcement agency.  Rustamjon has worked for over eight years as a bank guard.  He earns an additional income by offering taxi services.  Rustamjon and his wife use the money they earn to support their family.  They live in a very old house that Rustamjon's father built.  He needs to repair the house, but he doesn't have the money to buy the building materials or pay the builders.  He is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy building materials.  He is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing for house

loans.name: Gombojav

texts.en:
Mr. Gombojav, 24 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a manager in an advertisement and decoration business since 2011. His wife has a bachelor's degree as a programmer, but now cares for her children, 1 and 3 years old, at home. The family resides in a house on their own land. Gombojav has a spirit guide within himself and invokes in a separate ger (Mongolian traditional yurt).

As winter comes to Mongolia, the family's house becomes frozen due to vulnerable walls and doors and chills the family to its core. Gombojav is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy foam as an insulating material and a storm door. This will enable the family to live in a comfortable place and reduce their consumption of coal, thus drastically contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy insulating material and a storm door

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma, 42 years old, lives in the Tskaltubo District with her daughter and grandchildren. On several occasions, Irma has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but has had no success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Irma has requested a loan from Credo to start a business selling clothing. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Irma will purchase clothes in Tbilisi at wholesale prices and resell them in her district for a profit. It will be hard work for Irma but, according to estimations, her business will be profitable and will increase the family's income. The increased profit will be reinvested in the business to increase her stock and sales volume. Family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more textiles to make sports attire

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine's group is comprised of 4 hardworking women. Josephine, 18 years old, lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her stock of essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar,and salt to attract more customers, and will help Josephine to generate greater profits and to pay for her medical bills. Josephine hopes that, in the future, she will be able to start a big supermarket in town. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to increase her stock of essential commodities to attract more customers

loans.name: Natsadorj

texts.en:
Mr. Natsagdorj, 46, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own apartment. Their daughter has been studying at university for two years in Korea. The family's main income comes from a food store and internet café; both businesses were started in 2010. Operational apartments are rented for long term and therefore business is stabilized over the years. 

In order to expand his business, he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 Tugriks (MNT) to increase the current assets of his business. As a result, he can generate more income for his family also can contribute to national economic prosperity because small and medium sized businesses are vital to economic development. In addition, the borrower has a goal of building his own block factory in the future.

loans.use: to increase current assets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: 3.5.215.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thiệu  works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Thiệu has been involved in this business for six years.

Thiệu is 30 years old; she is married with two children.Thiệu is the group leader of the 3.5.215.Thiệu Trung Solidarity Group, which consists of five members. Thiệu supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Thiệu's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thiệu hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 24 years old and lives in the suburbs of Tbilisi city with her mother and brother. Several times, Diana has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly income earned by Diana working as a saleslady. 

Diana requested a loan from Credo to start a clothing sales business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Diana will purchase clothes in Turkey at wholesale prices and resell them in the local market for a profit. It will be hard work for Diana, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in her clothing trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson de 31 años de edad tiene su negocio en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, zona comercial que alberga gran cantidad de negocios de diversos tamaños y líneas de productos, siendo el de él la venta de accesorios femeninos y cosméticos, con el que planea su futuro.   Cuando Nelson inició su negocio, ya había abonado el terreno para lograrlo; primero empezó a trabajar como jefe de meseros y se dispuso ahorrar para ser independiente, desarrollar su espíritu libre, emprendedor y  su propia autonomía. Aun en ese tiempo no sabía a qué se dedicaría, pero las relaciones comerciales que observaba, fueron direccionando sus posibilidades, especialmente  conociendo a los  comerciantes de artículos de bisutería. Así fue  que compro una colmena o punto comercial donde iniciar y como siguió trabajando como empleado, pudo obtener otra unidad de negocios y continuar en el restaurante,  donde aún es apoyado por sus jefes,  para que progrese teniendo sus negocios también y generando empleos, porque para ellos  cuenta con una auxiliar de ventas. Él se siente muy feliz con sus actividades, pues gracias a ellas, ha logrado viajar a otros países como Panamá y Perú; Nelson se considera muy emprendedor y con un potencial exitoso para salir adelante.  En su negocio abre sus puertas de Lunes a Domingos desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6:30 de la tarde, vende de contado y tiene como propósito hacer crecer su negocio, por eso se acerca a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a un crédito, primer financiamiento que hace mediante el fondo  Kiva, con el cual comprará a un mayor volumen, productos de bisutería,  como collares, ganchos, aretes y pulseras;  con ellos  renovará sus inventarios y obtendrá por compras de contado y en mayor cantidad,  precios que trasladará a su clientela,  para que se sientan felices con su respuesta oportuna y regresen a comprarle.
texts.en:
Nelson is 31 years old. His business is in the center of the city of Barranquilla in the commercial zone, which is home to a large number of businesses of different sizes and product lines. He sells female accessories and cosmetics, with which he plans his future.

When Nelson started his business, he had already paved the way to success. He first started working as the head waiter and began saving to be independent, and develop his free, entrepreneurial spirit. Even at that time he didn't know to what he would devote himself, but with the trade relations he observed, he was directed to the costume jewelry merchants. So he bought a commercial point to start while he continued working so he could start his business while continuing at the restaurant. Therefore, he would be supported while creating his business and creating his own jobs, such as sales assistant.

He is very happy with his activities, because thanks to them, he has managed to travel to other countries, such as Panama and Peru. Nelson is considered very enterprising and successful with the potential to grow. 

In his business, the doors are open Monday to Sunday from 8:00 in the morning until 6:30 in the afternoon. He wants to grow his business, so he approached the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to apply for a loan financed by Kiva. 

With this loan, he will buy a large volume of jewelry such as necklaces, clips, earrings, and bracelets. With them he will renew his inventory and get more since he is purchasing with cash and in a large quantity. The prices will transfer to his customers, so they will feel happy and return to buy more from him.

loans.use: to buy a large volume of jewelry, such as necklaces, clips, earrings and bracelets.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Violet is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is single and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Violet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Violet has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt that will attract more customers. This will help Violet generate greater profits and pay her medical bills. Violet hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a big supermarket. 

Violet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt that will attract more customers.

loans.name: Fernanda Leonor

texts.es:
FERNANDA LEONOR tiene 20 años de edad de estado civil uniòn libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los rìos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA VICTORIA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

FERNANDA LEONOR  se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Las compras las realizarà en la ciudad de Ventanas. Solicita el crèdito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas, ranger.

 Con la ayuda del crédito ayudarà a la familia a mejorar la calidad de vida. El sueño es comprarce una casa.Los desafìos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas y enfermedades en las plantaciones. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte en especial el bono.
texts.en:
Fernanda Leonor, 20, lives with her husband and two children in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  She is a member of the communal bank LA VICTORIA in the Pantano Community which belongs to the Ventanas Canton.  Here, most people work in agriculture and livestock farming.

Fernanda Leonor grows corn and rice, and buy supplies in the city of Ventanas.  She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, urea, ferilizers and insecticides.

The loan will help improve her family's quality of life.  Her goal is to buy a house.  The challenges she is up against are plant plagues and diseases.

In her free time, she enjoys sports.

loans.use: To buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Milton Jacinto

texts.es:
MILTON JACINTO tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil unión libre tiene 5 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Pertenece a la  VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

 MILTON JACINTO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y a la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, insecticidas y balanceado para engorde de cerdos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar los cultivos y engordar a los cerdos para venderlo en un buen precio.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas cada mes. El sueño es poder tener buena cosecha y verder bien los animales para tener dinero para hacer una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas y los precios de los animales de la competencia.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte con los hijos.
texts.en:
Milton Jacinto, 32, lives with his common-law wife and five children in Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  He belongs to the communal bank EL RECREO, located in the San Vicente Las Lomas Community which belongs to the Ventanas Canton.  Here, people work in agriculture and livestock farming.

Milton Jacinto farms corn and rice, and raises pigs.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and balanced animal feed for the pigs.  The loan will allow him to improve the crops and fatten the pigs so he can sell them at a good price.

He buys supplies in Ventanas every month.  His goal is to have a good harvest and sell his animals well so he can build a house.  The challenges he is up against are plant disease and competitive livestock prices.

In his free time, he enjoys playing sports with his children.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and balanced animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 22 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 3 years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her market stall, which sells raw food.

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw food such as cassava and sweet potatoes, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own.

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw food such as cassava and sweet potatoes for resale

loans.name: Jalil

texts.en:
Jalil is 53 years old and is married with one child. Jalil has worked as a driver for 10 years. Now he helps move people from one region to another.

To support better family living conditions, he was engaged with fruits and vegetables selling. His wife was helping him but after she has got sick he had to stop this business as he had no financial support and help. 

Today after six months he decided to continue the trading business and applied for the loan 1000 Azerbaijanian Manats (AZN) to buy fruits and vegetables to start selling at the local market that he has rented.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to start selling at the local market that he has rented.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Prisca has been working hard to manage her market stall, which sells raw food.

To help expand her business, Prisca has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw bananas called matooke to be sold, and will help Prisca to generate greater profits and pay her medical bills. Prisca hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own.

Prisca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw bananas called matooke to be sold

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is married with two children. Liezl is 29 years old and lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Liezl sells noodles, canned goods and other items to earn a living, and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP for additional capital to purchase more items to sell.

Liezl has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Liezl hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, canned goods and other items.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has two children; one of them is currently in school. For the past two years, Christine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase stock of essential commodities, such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt, that will attract more customers, hence increasing profits. This will help Christine to generate greater profits and pay her medical bills. Christine hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a big supermarket. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase stock of essential commodities, such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt, that will attract more customers, hence increasing profits.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is single and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Margret has been working hard to manage her market stall, which sells raw foods. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw bananas, called matooke, to resell. This will help Margret generate greater profits and pay her medical bills. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw bananas, called matooke, to be resell

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Grace is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Grace has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt to attract more customers.  This will help Grace generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to buy cows and build a house. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt to attract more customers

loans.name: Nyamaa

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamaa, 23 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (a traditional Mongolian yurt) in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife, Bayanjargal, age 22, is temporarily unemployed after giving birth to their daughter and she stays home to take care of her.

Nyamaa has been an assistant worker in a small private shoe manufacturing business for years. Since they have a newborn and his wife is not working, Nyamaa is planning to start his own business manufacturing shoes at home with his wife. He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for his new cobbler business. Nyamaa is a well-behaved, hardworking and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his start-up cobbler business

loans.name: Felipe Francisco

texts.es:
Felipe Francisco tiene 47 años de edad vive en Unión Libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Felipe Francisco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol y la crianza de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, urea, insecticidas, líquido para la maleza y para balanceado de engorde y morocho para los pollos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario. Las compras lo harán en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

El sueño es poder comprar lo necesario para los cultivos y un terreno para seguir sembrando. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Felipe Francisco, 47, lives with his common-law wife and children in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.  He is a member of the communal bank EL RECREO, in a sector of the San Vicente Las Lomas Community which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  Here, people work in agriculture and livestock farming.

Felipe Francisco farms corn and beans and raises chickens.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticides, liquid weedkiller and balanced animal feed for the chickens.

The loan will help him buy everthing he needs; and he will purchase the supplies in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

His goal is to buy all he needs for his crops and a patch of land to continue farming.  In his free time, he enjoys sports.

loans.use: To buy seed, urea, insecticides, liquid weed killer and balanced animal feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La Sra. Mery es una persona con altos valores espirituales los cuales le han guiado a ser una buena persona, ella se define como una persona perseverante, humilde y muy trabajadora, ella es casada, ama a su esposo y a sus 3 hijos. Mery cree que el trabajo dignifica a la persona y es el único medio de salir adelante.

El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se lo va a invertir en la compra de tela e hilos para la confección de cobijas de bebe, ya que en estas fechas tiene mucha demanda de su producto, ya que es muy conocido en toda la ciudad por su calidad y su precio.

El sueño que Mery tiene es tener más capital para crecer en su microempresa, abarcar un mayor mercado y ser reconocida en toda la ciudad, igualmente sueña con ver a sus hijos crecer y darles una buena educación y sobre todo ser una familia unida por el amor.
texts.en:
Mery is someone with high spiritual values that have made her a good person.  She defines herself as persevering, humble and hard-working.  She is married and loves her husband and three children.  Mery believes work dignifies a person and is the only way to get ahead.

The loan she is requesting through Fodemi is to buy fabric and thread to make baby blankets, since there is a high demand for them at this time of the year.  Her products are well known in the city for their quality and price.

Mery's goal is to have more capital to grow her small business so she can supply to a larger market and be recognized throughout the entire city.  She also wants to see her children grow up with a good education and in a loving family environment.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread to make baby blankets.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La Sra. Gabriela indudablemente es una persona de admiración, siempre con una sonrisa y alegría que le caracteriza, ella se define como una persona, paciente humilde y muy trabajadora. Ella confía mucho en su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante, Gabriela ama a toda su familia y lucha por verles siempre felices.


El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se lo va a invertir en la compra cosméticos de perfumería, cremas corporales y faciales, Para Gabriela es una forma de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia, es una oportunidad de crecimiento personal y familiar, es por ello que Gabriela está muy gustosa de trabajar y con ganas de mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.

El sueño que Gabriela tiene es poder tener un local propio y amplio donde pueda vender todos su productos y diversificar su mercancía y con estos ingresos mejorar su casa y darles la educación a sus hijos, Gabriela tiene mucha fe en Dios, y está convencida que con trabajo y amor su sueño se cumplirá.
texts.en:
Gabriela is undoubtedly an admirable person.  She always has a smile and she is characterized by her happiness.  She is described as a patient, humble, and hard-working person.  She puts a lot of trust in her work and her desire to get ahead.  She loves her entire family and fights to see them always happy.

The loan she is requesting is from FODEMI; she will invest in buying cosmetics, like perfumes, body creams, and facial creams.  For Gabriela, this is a way to continue moving forward and to help her family; it is an opportunity for personal and familial growth.  It is for this that Gabriela is very joyful in her work and desire to better the quality of life for her whole family.

Gabriela's dream is to be able to have her own sufficient space where she can sell all of her products and diversify her merchandise.  With this revenue, she can improve her home and give her children an education.  

Gabriela has a lot of faith in God and is convinced that with hard work and love, her dream will come true.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, like perfume, body creams and facial creams.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio, tiene la edad 32 de  años, está casado y vive con la esposa y tres hijos. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de dos vacas de leche para poder darle el mayor provechó posible con los diversos productos. El lo que  pretende es poder vender productos como leche y queso y hasta un poco de natilla. El quiere poder aumentar los ingresos con este nuevo proyecto y así poder aumentar las  ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de ganado de leche.
