Betty is 45 years old and a member of the Kyosiga Kyo’kungura group. She is a widow whose husband passed on and left her with four children. All of them go to school.

Betty collects maize from different villages and brings it to the milling machine. She started this job in 2002 when her husband had passed away to support her family since she was the bread winner. Betty’s dream is to see her children successfully finish school and have a bright future so that they can help her out during her old age.

Her major challenge is lack of enough capital which slows down the growth of her business. Betty is very hard working, social, and honest. She will use the loan to purchase more maize and to set up a store where she can always store her produce and be able to have a constant supply. The loan will allow her to be able to earn a consistent and stable income to support her family and educate her children up to higher institutions of learning.

loans.use: to purchase maize to sell

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is 53 years old and is the mother of five children. She is very responsible and lives with her family. Mwanahamisi has a small grocery store in her home. She has had this business for over five years. It’s gone well and is very well known. She has managed to provide everything for her children in this manner, working from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm, in the hope that she will make the greatest number of sales possible.

She is asking for a loan so that she can buy inventory, such as basic grains, flour and snacks. Mwanahamisi wants to improve her earnings, so she needs to optimize her business and gain more customers.

loans.use: to buy inventory, such as basic grains, flour and snacks

loans.name: Mihane

texts.en:
Mihane is forty-three and a married mother of six children, three boys and three girls. Her husband is disabled. They live in the southern part of Kosovo in very poor conditions. To earn a living, Mihane is planning to start her own business in the local market selling used phones and wallets. Because her husband is disabled, she must work hard to support her family.
She is in need of a loan in the amount of 1500 Euro in order to buy used phones and wallets at cheap prices and then to sell them at a higher price in the market. 
Mihane is considering this a profitable business and she hopes to have income to support her family. She hopes in the future to get a shop for selling her products and her goal is to have better living conditions for her family. 
Knowing that it is a Kiva loan she wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy used phones and wallets

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 27 years old, and is a single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has worked in the taxi business for three years. First, he was unemployed, then he worked with his friend`s taxi to improve his living conditions. He applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to repair his car to continue working well. He hopes to own a taxi instead of a hired car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is 31 years old and married with three children. His spouse runs the family’s farming business which helps in producing some additional income. Mathew runs a small bakery in Kabarnet town where he bakes cakes, bread, and other snacks. He has been in this business for the last six years and his monthly income from the business is Kshs 20,000.

He has applied for his sixth loan of Kshs 30,000, which he intends to use to purchase more baking ingredients like baking flour, baking powder, yeast, and eggs among other items. He plans to use the additional income to expand his business and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase baking ingredients

loans.name: Peruth

texts.en: Peruth is 30 years old. She is married with two children between the ages of one and three. Her husband works as a farmer. With the loan, she will buy more local beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy local beer to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, 42, is hard-working and has been involved in the sale of personal grooming products for the past six years. She is the mother of six children, between the ages of 10 and 25 years, only two of whom are attending school. 

She started her business with a little money she had saved with a saving club. She sells body cream, hair oil, hand cream, and other personal grooming products, in the market. She has requested this loan to purchase more of those items, for resale in her business. Because of the good interaction with her customers, she makes profit when she sells. She sells eleven hours a day. 

Sarah thanks the lenders for their support in her business. With the profit that she generates from the business she intends to buy more inventory and attend to the needs of her children. Sarah hopes to build a house in the future, and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, hair oil, and other personal grooming products, for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 46 years old. She has sold sorghum and beans for the past five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum to use in making local beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land where she plans to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to use in making local beer

loans.name: Al-Gbool Group

texts.en:
Al-Gbool is a loan group consisting of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB to be apportioned among the group members.

Hanan is 24 years old, married and has four children. She owns a small house which she would like to add onto and renovate. She will use her 40,000 YER portion to buy construction materials to use on her house. She hopes this project will be successful.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to use on her house.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 49 years old. She is married with three children. She sells foodstuffs and has been running the business for the past three years. With the loan, she wants to buy rice, potatoes and bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow in the near future, which will provide milk for the family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en: Jeanette is 30 years old. She is married with five children. She sells wheat flour and is a wine distributor. She has been running the business for the past three years. With the loan, she wants to buy more wheat flour and wine to sell. Jeanette plans to use the profits to buy cattle.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour and wine to sell.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en: Emerita is 36 years old. She is married with four kids. With the loan, she wants to buy more soaps, sugar, and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Ancille

texts.en: Ancille is 50 years old. She sells wood and timber. Her husband works as a farmer. They have 13 children who are between six and 34; they all go to school except the oldest who got married. With the loan, she wants to buy more wood to sell The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more wood to sell

loans.name: Jursun

texts.ru: Журсун 35 лет, замужем, мать двоих детей. Не далеко от села Чуй, расположен  один из самых крупных скотских рынков Центральной Азии. Журсун начала заниматься животноводством  ставшим основным источником финансирования ее семьи. Журсун начала свой бизнес со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS) в 2009 году, и смогла развить свое хозяйство, на сегодняшний день она имеет в обороте 60,000 сом (KGS). Скот она покупает и продает на местном скотском рынке. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Журсун обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота для перепродажи. Доходы Журсун планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем - построить магазин.
texts.en: Jursun is 35 years old, married and a mother to two children. Located not far from Chui village is one of the biggest livestock markets in Central Asia. Jursun began practicing animal husbandry as a main source of income for her family. Jursun started her business with an initial investment of 10,000 som (KGS) in 2009 and has been able to develop her business to currently generate 60,000 som (KGS). She buys and sells cattle at the local livestock market. For the purposes of the furthur development of her business, Jursun approached the company "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cattle for resale. Jursun plans on investing the profits in the further expansion of her livestock numbers, and in the future, she plans to build a store.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle for resale

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie, 44, is married and the mother of three children between the ages of nine and twelve. Her husband, children and she live in Congo Town where her children attend school.

For the past five years Mamie has been selling fish in the marketplace; prior to this she sold palm oil. She learned her sales skills from her mother. Her business is profitable because she always has on hand her customers’ favorite, the cassava fish. She sells twelve hours a day and transports her fish by commercial vehicle.

Mamie is requesting a 20,000 LRD loan from BRAC Liberia to buy more cartons of fish to sell. Her goal is to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of fish to sell.

loans.name: Kihayura Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Story given by Yoweri, standing on the extreme left, with a bag.

Yoweri is a married man, age 45, who has four children. All of them are school going. He is a produce dealer (maize and beans). He does both the growing and selling. He started this in 2007, in order to increase the family income so that he can educate the children.

Yoweri wants a loan of 500,000 UGX to add produce to the business, since the season is on and demand is high. His major customers are residents of his area and its outskirts, where he operates the business. He hopes that, if given this loan, he will be able to expand the business and use the profits to improve the living standard of the family. He wants to build a permanent, residential house and educate the children. 

His major challenge is limited capital, plus transporting the produce from the village to the market. He would like the financial services to be provided to his group, whenever there is need for them.

In the photo is the whole group, even though some members are not taking part of this current loan. They signed and consented to have their photos published as a sign of solidarity, since the loan will help members of their group.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans, for planting and for sale

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza, along with her co-worker Samah, runs a play center from her home. They have fifteen children from their village who come for games and activities. The children love the games and activities and the parents trust Aziza and Samah.  They want to extend the play area and upgrade the playground outside. 

Aziza needs this loan to assist with paying for renovations, such as new windows, doors and flooring.

Aziza thoroughly enjoys working with the children and one day wants to open a daycare and gain daycare management certification.

loans.use: To pay for renovations, including new windows, doors and flooring.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en: Patricie is age 42. She is married with three children and all the children go to school. She sells bananas and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah and Aziza runs a play center from Aziza’s home. They have 15 children from their village who come for games and activities. The children love the games and activities, and the parents trust Samah and Aziza. Samah and Aziza want to expand the activities and play area. 

Samah needs this loan to assist with paying for maintenance, a kitchen, and games.

Samah loves working with the children and plans on one day opening a daycare. She wants to study daycare management.

loans.use: to assist with paying for maintenance, a kitchen, and games.

loans.name: Eline

texts.en: Eline is 52 years old. She sells beer and sodas. She is married with four children. Her husband works together with her in the same business. She wants the loan to buy more beer and soda to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is a married business man who owns a butchery; a trade he has run for about a year. He employs three other people in the business. He is also a farmer.

He learned of Milango from a friend and joined in order to access funds. He is applying for a loan of 73,100 Kenya shillings to buy stock for the butchery e.g. beef and poultry meat, rice, sugar, flour, etc. 

The only challenges in the business are bad debts and a lack of adequate meat supply, but Patrick is determined to carry out his operations well because he believes that it is from such a venture that he can establish his family. His future ambition is to be able to open other stalls/shops. He believes this will help him educate his children.

loans.use: to buy stock for his butchery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, rice etc.

loans.name: Nekruz

texts.ru:
Некруз проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 20 лет. Он холост. Некруз живет с родителями. Он в 17 лет начал свое дело. Некруз хорошо разбирается в автомашинах. Он у себя дома предоставляет услугу. Некруз открыл автосервис, где занимается ремонтом автомашин. 
Некруз просит кредит для приобретения необходимого оборудования.
texts.en: Nekruz lives in Isfara city. He is 20 years old and unmarried. He lives with his parents. He began his business at 17 years old. Nekruz understands cars extremely well and provides automotive services out of his house.Nekruz opened an autobody garage where he repairs cars. Nekruz is requesting a loan to purchase necessary technical equipment.

loans.use: to purchase a specialized computer and camber.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en: Jeannette is 34 years old. She is married with five children. They all go to school. With the loan, she wants to add more soap, rice, and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees for the children and for savings to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more soap, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Mariatu from Waterloo in the eastern part of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with two children who are 15 and 25 years old. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2002, Mariatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support her child's education. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation costs.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to buy more shoe bags and dresses for the festive season. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. The other woman featured in the video is the SEP Officer of the Waterloo branch. In the future, Mariatu plans to operate a clothing wholesale business. She thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Mariatu from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more shoe bags and dresses for the festive season.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en: Festus is aged 47 years. He sells foodstuffs and has been selling foodstuffs for the past five years. With the loan, he wants to buy more rice, sugar and many more grocery items. With the profits from the business he will reinvest in the same business, as well as making savings for the future.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, and many items more for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more compact discs.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is a resident of the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady.  Celina owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for eleven years. Celina began the business through the savings she made from casual jobs. In this shop, she sells paraffin, sugar, flour etc. Her husband is also employed.

She learned about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. The main challenges are high transport costs and price fluctuations.   

Celina is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase rice, sugar, flour, and other non-perishables for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on their living standards. She aspires to own other centers and plan for her children’s education with much security.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, flour, and other non-perishables for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  purchase a new stock of clothes in preparation for the festive season.

loans.name: Chitai

texts.en:
Chitai lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a green grocery that he has been operating for three years. He sells fruits and vegetables. He set up the business from his savings.

He learned about Milango through friends, and came in with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge has been lack of funds for business operations.

Chitai is applying for a loan of 15,850 Kenyan shillings, to build a permanent shelter for the business and to increase stock by buying produce, like mangoes and oranges. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings and used to improve the living standard of his family, especially in the area of education. His dream is to own a larger grocery stall, with high levels of stock.

loans.use: To a build shelter for the business and increase stock, like mangoes and oranges.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул 37 лет, воспитывает 2 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Айгул занимается животноводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS) в 2005 году, хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На данный момент в хозяйстве Айгул имеется одна корова и одна лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айгул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Доходы Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Aigul is 37 years old and is raising 2 children. As a source of income for her family, Aigul practices animal husbandry. Beginning with an initial investment of 2,000 som (KGS) in 2005, her agricultural business currently brings in around 12,000 som (KGS) a month from the sale of milk and dairy products. At the moment, Aigul has one cow and one horse on her farm. For the further development of her business, Aigul approached the company "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase a milk cow. Aigul plans to invest the profits in the further expansion of her livestock herd.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for inflatable games, bars for the fence enclosure, and a door and materials for the culture corner, and to renovate the nature path.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya and runs a food cafe which has been open for three years and employs two other people. He is a married father of two school going children. In this business, Morris sells cooked food. He also owns a clothing workshop.
Morris aspires to own another, larger business space where he can sell his food products. Morris learnt of Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stocks of food stuffs, such as, wheat and maize flour, rice, beans, etc. He also aspires to move to a new venue, carry out good business and establish a hotel in the future. 
Morris believes the additional income from this loan will help him to provide good forms of education for his children.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of food stuffs, such as wheat and maize flour, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia, 33, lives in the Congo Town community, with her husband and three children. Her children are between the ages of 18 and 20, and are in school. Lucia has a cook shop (restaurant) in her community, where she has been selling food for the past four years. She sells six days a week, preparing different kinds of dishes every day for her customers. She prepares cassava leaves, palava sours, palm butter, and okra sauce, to meet her customers' demands. Because of her good service to her customers she makes profit every day. 

She greatly appreciates the lenders, for their support in her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for the restaurant, so she can increase her sales. Her future plan is to build a house, and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for the business, so she can increase her sales.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, thirty-six, is a hard working and loving mother of five children. She stopped her education in the seventh grade.  Her children are between the ages of one and twelve and only three of them are attending school. For the past ten years she has been selling bath soap, washing soap, batteries, mineral water and many other items in her community. Ruth is out selling items thirteen hours a day and transports her goods by commercial vehicle. 
Ruth's husband gave her the initial capital to start in this business. She like this business because she is able to earn her own income and assist her husband with the expenses for their home. She is grateful to the lenders for empowering her in her business. Ruth's future plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more washing soap, bath soap, batteries, and mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, 45, is a married mother of five children. They live in the Congo Town community. Her children are between the ages of 20 and 32. One is attending school and lives at home, and the other four children are independent and live outside the home. Her husband is a driver, and she has been involve in the sales of used clothing for the past five years. She sells men's clothing, including shirts, trousers, and shorts. She sells eleven hours a day, and her husband's taxi is used to transport her goods to her business area. 

Martha is very proud of her business, because she makes a profit, and with the profit she buys more goods and contributes toward household expenses. She also appreciates the lenders for empowering her in her business. She is requesting this loan to purchase more men's trousers, shirts, and shorts for the business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more men's trousers, shirts, and shorts for her business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort, 39 years old, is a hardworking mother that has been managing her business for the past five years. She has four children between the ages of 2 and 21. Three of the children are attending school. Comfort has a table at the market where she sells Vita, rice, salt, pepper, palm oil, cooking oil, onions and many other items. She learned to sell from her husband, and he gave her the small amount of 4,000 LD (Liberian Dollar) to start in this business. She sells from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and transports her goods by commercial vehicle. 

She thanks the lenders for their support in her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more Vita, salt, onions, and palm oil for the business in order to increase her sales. Her plan is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more Vita, salt, onions, and palm oil for the business to increase her sales.

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Alie from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with four children between the ages of 5 and 21 years old. Three of his children are currently attending school. He began this business because he did not go to school.

Alie sells local foodstuff. He sells pepper, palm oil and gari. He has been running this business for 25 years. He works at the business every day from morning to night. His business is the only income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is insufficient capital to run his business.

Alie has requested a loan in order to buy more local foodstuff like pepper, palm oil and gari to expand his business. The woman featured in the video is the SEP officer from the Waterloo branch. The extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children since he did not go to school. In the future, he plans to be a supplier of local foodstuff. He appreciates your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Alie from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more local foodstuff like pepper, palm oil and gari

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Mohamed from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. He is married with two children who are two and six years old. One of his children currently attends school. Mohamed was a student but he lost his parent and there was no one to take care of his education, so he decided to start a business at an early age. 

Mohamed runs a general stock business at his store in a business market area.  He sells rice and flour. He has been running his business since an early age. He works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week.  He does not have any other source of income.   

Mohamed has requested a loan in order to purchase more rice for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow him to take care of his children's welfare and increase his capital. The woman featured in the video is the SEP officer from the Waterloo branch. In the future, he plans to open another big store in a different location. He thanks you for your support!

video.title: Kiva Borrower Mohamed from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a professional oven, a pastry oven, a mixer and other supplies and materials.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Adiza. She is married and has two children, aged 17 and 13 years. One is a school-going child. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she assists in his schooling and accommodation.  

In 2007, Adiza established her clothing and home product business, which sells shirts, jeans, nappies, knickers, wrappers, towels, powder, bedspreads, creams, and other products. She began her business because she stopped schooling in Class V and has a health problem. She used to assist her mother in operating her business. She later married a contractor who established a small business stall for her. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 1,950,000 every month from this business. 

Adiza would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase jeans (eight dozen @ Le 360,000); skirts (five dozen @ Le 300,000); and blouses (10 pieces @ Le 12,000). In the future, Adiza plans to build a house, acquire a shop, educate her children and improve her family's standard of living. This loan will help her to earn more income. She is hardworking and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business

loans.name: Osooso

texts.en: Osooso is a 29-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, ta'amu, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Osooso has requested a loan to buy chemicals, shovels, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Osooso hopes to use her earnings to expand her family's house.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, shovels, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Kadiatu J

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 1. She has one additional dependent who lives with her in foster care.  

In 1998, Kadiatu established her business selling vegetable oil, flour, sugar, tomato paste, butter, ketchup, maggi (a product for enhancing the flavor of soups and stews), mayonnaise, etc.  She began her business because she did not have the opportunity to attend school. She used to assist her uncle's wife in business. When she got married, her husband gave her some money to start a business.  

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Kadiatu  requires a loan in order to purchase eggs - 5 cartons @ Le250,000, vegetable oil - 8 rubbers @ Le130,000, sugar - 4 bags @ Le220,000, maggi - 6 cartons @ Le175,000, couscous - 6 cartons @ Le85,000.  The balance of Le20, 000 will be used for transportation.  

In the future, Kadiatu plans to build a house, provide quality education for her children, and acquire a shop. She is hard working and honest.She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy eggs, maggi, vegetable oil, sugar, mayonnaise, couscous, etc. for her grocery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cotton napkins, towels and baby panties for her clothing business.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en: This is 38 year-old Abdulai.  He is married and has four children ages 18, 14, 11 and 4, all attending school. In 2006, Abdulai established his business selling tablets of paracetamol, septrin, ORS, metro, B & S, diclofinac, ampiclox, amplicilin, amoxycilin etc. He began his business because he came from a poor family so his parents were able to pay his school fees up to Form V but no further. His family could not afford his college fees.  He engaged in cassava and groundnut farming and the proceeds were used to start petty trading.  Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,310,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Abdulai has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy paracetamol tablets - 4 cartons @ Le280,000, ORS - 2 cartons @ Le450,000, syrup for adults - 100 bottles @ Le8000, syrup for children - 150 bottles @ Le4,000, novalgine Injections - 18 boxes @ Le60,000. In the future, Abdulai plans to build a house, educate his children, acquire a bigger shop and open another outlet.  This loan will help to generate more income. Inadequate capital is his major problem.  He is hardworking and honest.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for his business.

loans.name: Fatmata J.

texts.en: This is 36 year-old Fatmata.  She is single and has two children ages 12 and 6, both attending school. In 2008, Fatmata established her business selling provisions (biscuits, cigarettes, drinks, soap, pure water, paste, Ovaltine, mayonnaise, milk etc.). She began her business because she left school due to mistreatment from her stepmother.  She got into an early marriage and her husband gave her some money to start a business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,050,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid  one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy batteries - 5 cartons @ Le178,000, black mint - 4 cartons @ Le225,000, sweets - 4 cartons @ Le155,000, cigarettes - 3 cartons @ Le85,000, mosquito coils - 5 cartons @ Le95,000, biscuits -  2 cartons @ Le75,000, toothpaste - 2 cartons Le150,000. The balance of Le10,000 will be used to pay laborers. In the future, Fatmata plans to educate her children, develop her piece of land and expand business. This loan will help her to achieve some of her future plans. Inadequate capital is her major challenge. She is a hardworking and honest business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy batteries, black mint, sweets, mosquito coils, biscuits etc. for her store.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 51 year-old Fatmata.  She is married,and has four children ages 22, 17, 13 and 4.  Three are attending school. She has one additional dependent who lives with her in foster care.  In 1991, Fatmata established her groundnuts business. She began her business because she stopped her education in Form II, and her parents gave her some money to start selling porridge.  Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1450000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 . Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy groundnuts - 10 bags @ Le300,000. In the future, Fatmata plans to build a house, educate her children and open a shop.  This loan will help to increase stock and earn more profit.  Inadequate capital is her major challenge. She is hard working business woman.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more ground nut for her business.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
This is Sandra; she previously accessed a PHP 30,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities of dried fish to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 loan to pay for dried fish needed in her business. The more dried fish displayed at her stall the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Sandra hopes she will succeed through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship group members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.*

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of dried fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Aminata.  She is married and has four children aged 18, 14, 11,  and 10 years old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because he needs assistance. 

In 1996, Aminata established her plastic shoes business. She began her business because she did not have the privilege of attending school and had assisted her mother to sell cakes. She married a businessman who gave her money to start a business. Aminata works seven days a week and 11 hours each day; she earns about Le 2,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Aminata has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy plastics shoes - 33 packets @ Le 150,000 in addition to comfort slippers. The balance Le 50,000 will be used as transportation.

In the future, Aminata plans to acquire a shop, build a house on a piece of land they have acquired, and provide quality education for her children.   Changes in prices are her major challenge. This loan will create room for development in her business. Sometimes transportation cost is high. She is a  hardworking and determined business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy plastic shoes for women and comfort slippers; the remaining balance will be used to pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en: Gaudiosa is a 60-year-old farmer from Ubay, Bohol. She has been in the rice farming business together with her husband for several years now. Gaudiosa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, they will be able to enhance their harvest from the farm. In the future, Gaudiosa hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
This is Nena; she previously accessed an PHP 25,000 loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan for her to buy ingredients like pork, eggs, rice, noodles, ham, and other products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nena dreams of giving her child a good and high-quality education and hopes that her house renovation will end soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients like pork, eggs, rice, noodles, ham, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a 42-year-old fisherman from Bohol, Philippines. He is a married man and father of eight children.

Eduardo needs a loan to buy new fishing nets, hooks and fuel for the boat. With this, he will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Eduardo has hopes of expanding his fishing business in order to augment his income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, hooks and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Isatu B.

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Isatu B. She is married to a contractor and has four children aged 16, 14, 12, and nine years. All are school going children. In 1996, Isatu B. established her baby clothing and utensils business. She began her business because she came from a poor background; she had to do petty trading after school hours to pay her school fees. Things got harder for her because she had to drop out of school. She was peddling everyday to help her parents and younger ones. She then got married and her husband helped her with a small amount of funds for the business. Since then, she has developed gradually. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 5,481,000 every month from this business. 

Isatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Isatu B has already received and successfully repaid two loans. She now requires a new loan in order to purchase baby powder - 10 dozen @ Le180,000, Baby clothing - 10 dozen @ Le180,000, Baby oil (small size) - 4 dozen @ Le100,000, Flask - 20 pieces @ Le150,000.She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 830,000. 

In the future, Isatu B. plans to open a shop and educate her children. The loan will help as it is an additional business capital. Isatu serves about 30 customers per day including women and petty traders around town and villages. Her business is popular because she always has good customer care and good quality goods at affordable prices. She usually travels by vehicle three times in the month to Freetown, and Conakry once every two months to purchase her goods. She saves some of her profit and uses some as an additional capital for the business.  

She has enough savings now that she has acquired a piece of land which she is looking forward to developing. She is also planning to expand her business by acquiring more loans and saving enough of her profit. She is hard working and competitive. Isatu B wants to achieve her dreams by educating her children through acquiring subsequent loans. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase baby wrappers - 4 dozen @ SLL 216,000, baby powder - 10 dozen @ SLL 80,000, baby walkers - 4 dozen @ SLL180,000 and flasks - 2 dozen @ SLL720,000, the balance of SLL 176,000 is to be used for transportation costs.

loans.name: Otgontuya

texts.en:
Otgontuya, 34 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in its own brick house. Every day from 7 am to 10 pm, her husband renders taxi service by using Otgontuya's own outdated car while she teaches physics at private school. Before rendering the taxi service, her husband worked in Korea through an employee contract.

This year, her husband’s car quality has deteriorated greatly, so the family is in need of new car. Otgontuya is requesting a loan of 6800000 MNT to purchase a new automobile which has an electric motor, thus, emitting less smoke and contributing to the efforts against air pollution. If the loan is issued, the family could purchase the new car. Usage of such cars should be encouraged, these cars are environmentally friendly.

loans.use: to support her husband's taxi service by buying a new car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat to resell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida, She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She also has a food stall. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Adelaida hopes that her business will grow even more and dreams to have a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Piedad

texts.es: Mucha mercancía fue la que vendió Piedad,  mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos, y ello lo logró  gracias a su anterior credikiva. Con esa inversión , dio respuesta a sus clientes, quienes  llevaron a su casa perfumes, productos capilares, accesorios femeninos y calzado comprados a crédito en el negocio de Piedad. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará productos capilares, perfumería, calzado y accesorios femeninos, para una vez más, responder a la demanda de fin de año, que es la mayor de toda la temporada y debe prepararse con buenos inventarios, para que no falte lo que su clientela requiera. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Que la vida los colme de muchas cosas, bonitas por pensar en ayudar a los más necesitados Porque “quien es generoso es más que justo
texts.en: Piedad sold a lot of merchandise through brochures and catalogs and she was able to do this thanks to her previous Kiva loan.  Her customers responded to this investment and took home perfumes, hair products, women’s accessories, and shoes purchased on credit from Piedad’s business.  Now she is asking for a new Kiva loan with which she will buy hair products, perfumes, shoes and ladies’ accessories so that she can respond to the end of year demand, which is her busiest time of year.  She needs to be prepared with a good inventory so that she will not be short of what her customers need.  Her message to the Kiva lenders is, “May life provide many nice things for you for thinking about helping those in need, because he who is generous is just.”

loans.use: to by inventory.

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es: Gallina criolla para la venta e insumos para preparar comidas en su restaurante, fue lo que compró Isabel Maria,  cuando recibió su credikiva anterior; este crédito fue muy positivo para ella, porque aumentó sus ventas por tener mayor capital de trabajo invertido, porque así pudo ofrecer mucho mas. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará gallina criolla y víveres nuevamente,  para elaborar comidas especiales, con las cuales deleitará el paladar de las familias en la época mas linda del año, la navidad y la llegada del año nuevo, porque la unidad del hogar es el elemento dinamizador, que permite celebrar alegres estas festividades y construir nuevos sueños de prosperidad para ser logrados durante el nuevo año que comienza.. .
texts.en: Creole chicken for sale and supplies to prepare her food in her restaurant was what Isabel Maria bought when she received her previous Kiva loan.  This loan was very positive for her because it increased her sales.  Having working capital allowed her to offer much more.  Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan to buy creole chicken and ingredients to make special food, with which she will tickle families’ taste buds during the loveliest time of the year, Christmas and the arrival of the New Year.  The unity of family is the dynamic element that allows one to celebrate these happy festivities and build new dreams of prosperity to be achieved during the coming year.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Narciso Antonio

texts.es:
NARCISO ANTONIO tiene 47 años de edad es soltero tiene 6 hijos, vive con la madre en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los rìos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA VICTORIA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

NARCISO ANTONIO se dedica a la agricultura a las siembras de maíz, arroz. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para la agricultura comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido mata monte, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrà mejorar el estilo de vida.

El sueño es comprarce un carro. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades, plagas en el cultivo.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Narciso Antonio is 47 years old and has six children.  He lives with his mother in the city of Ventanas within the Los Rios province.

He is a member of the LA VICTORIA communal bank, located in the Recinto wetlands, part of the Ventanas settlement.  The people here are farmers and raise livestock.

Narciso Antonio is a farmer and raises corn and rice.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas and is asking for a loan in order to buy insecticides, urea, weed killer, and fertilizers.  This loan will help him improve his quality of life.

His dream is to buy himself a car.  His challenges are crop diseases and plagues.

He likes to play sports in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Santiago Felipe

texts.es: Con su credikiva Santiago ha logrado reemplazar los créditos informales a costos mas altos y esto agradece  a sus finaciadores de Kiva; El dice a ellos: "Muchas gracias por la ayuda, me ha servido mucho en la realización de mi trabajo". Cuando Santiago recibió su anterior financiamiento, compró mas herramientas,  neumáticos, para vehículos y bicicletas, con los que pudo reparar y hacer mantenimiento preventivo a los carros, bicicletas y motocicletas de su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará llantas, candados, tensores, de motocicletas, cadenas y bujías, que son insumos de mayor rotación en su taller y debe estar preparado con inventarios, para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientela y generar mayores ingresos que los acostumbrados, convirtiendo su inversión de crédito en exitosa  .
texts.en: Santiago managed to use his Kiva loan to repay the informal loans he had which had higher costs, and for this he appreciates the Kiva lenders.  He says, “Thank you very much for the help.  It has been a great help to me in getting my work done.”  When Santiago received his previous loan, he bought more tools and tires for vehicles and bicycles, which allowed him to repair and do preventive maintenance on his customers’ cars, bicycles, and motorcycles.  He is asking for a new Kiva loan to buy tires, locks, motorcycle tensors, chains, and spark plugs.  These are the supplies that he uses the most in his shop and he needs to be prepared to satisfy his customer demand and generate greater revenue than normal.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Onisa

texts.es: Luisa desde que recibió su crédito  se encuentra más feliz, porque pudo ampliar su producción de raíces chinas, e incursionar en el comercio de los supermercados. Luisa considera que su negocio es una de sus grandes satisfacciones, porque le ha permitido consolidarse  y con sus códigos de barra, lograr ventas superiores a las acostumbradas, aplicando el capital de crédikiva  a sus productos y aumentando el  bienestar de su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará semillas, empaques, fertilizantes, que mejorarán la calidad de sus raíces, y logrará con ello aumentar sus niveles de comercialización, también realizará adecuaciones locativas que le permitirán trabajar adecuadamente. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “   Me considero afortunada, por su respaldo, y espero de la mano de ustedes, fortalecer mi negocio, y consolidarlo como una gran empresa”
texts.en: Luisa is very happy after receiving her loan because she is able to expand her production of Chinese roots and begin selling them in supermarkets.  Luisa considers her business to be one of her greatest satisfactions because it has allowed her to consolidate and make greater sales than normal by applying her new Kiva loan and improving her family’s wellbeing.  She is asking for a new Kiva loan to buy seeds, packaging, fertilizers that will improve the quality of her roots and allow her to increase her sales.  It will also allow her to make other improvements that will allow her to work adequately.  Her message to the Kiva lenders is, “I consider myself to be fortunate for having your backing and I hope that by your hand I will strengthen my business and consolidate it like a great company.”

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Atrevete A Emprender Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Atrévete a Emprender” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; lencería, venta de carteras, venta de manteles, bazar, venta de productos congelados, venta de ropa, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Luisa, integrante del Banco Comunal , quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en la últimas fila, es la más alta, viste polera de color blanca, en su cabeza sostiene unos lentes de sol, su cabello es de color castaño claro, lo usa largo y suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de longanizas  desde hace un mes. Comenta que trabaja desde su casa, empezó ofreciendo sus longanizas de voz en voz, ahora su clientela llega sola a su casa para comprar en grandes cantidades.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de San Carlos, donde compra por mayor a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará longanizas al por mayor.
Una de las metas de Luisa es continuar con el rubro, para abarcar mas clientela y abastecer su negocio de mas longanizas, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Luisa vive junto a su esposo y cuatro hijos de 20, 15, 12 y 9 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son estudiar peluquería, todo lo que abarque belleza, y  nivel familiar darles un buen pasar económico a su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones, Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Atrévete a Emprender” and is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who have different business, among them are: linen, wallets, table cloths, paper goods, frozen products, clothing sales, and other services.  All of them live in the city of Concepcion.

Luisa is a member of the communal bank.  In the image she is shown standing in the last row.  She is the tallest, wearing a white top and has a pair of sunglasses on her head.  She has chestnut hair and wears it long and loose.

She sells sausages and has done so for a month.  She says that she works from her home and started offering her sausages by word of mouth.  Now her customers visit her in her home to buy in large amounts.

She buys what she needs in San Carlos, where she buys in quantity, at low cost and therefore financially convenient.

She will use the money from this loan to buy sausages in quantity.

One of Luisa’s goals is to continue in her field to attract more customers and supply her business with sausages so that she can generate more income and improve her quality of life.  Luisa lives with her husband and four children, ages 20, 15, 12, and 9.  Her personal dreams are to study hairstyling and beauty and provide a good financial atmosphere for her family. 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given by Fondo Esperanza because it allows her to invest in her business.  She says that the training has been fundamental for her business and also for her own personal development because she has learned to organize and distribute her investments and revenues in a better way.  As far as her communal bank, she says that there is good communication among the members.

Concepción is located at the mouth of the Biobío river, one of the largest in the country, located in southern Chile, in the Biobío region.  It’s the center of important battles and significant settlements, especially during the Arauco war on the border of the Mapuche territory.  The city currently has the most important economic, demographic, managerial, financial, and commercial developments in Chile, after Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: to buy sausages in bulk.

loans.name: Roxana Eloisa

texts.es:
ROXANA ELOISA tiene 26 años de edad de estado civil uniòn libre tiene una hija, vive con el esposo y con la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA VICTORIA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

ROXANA ELOISA se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Las compras las realizarà en la ciudad de Ventanas. Solicita el crèdito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá invertir en la agricultura. El sueño es tener otro negocio para que haya otro ingreso. Los desafìos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta viajar para la playa.
texts.en:
Roxana Eloisa is 26 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a daughter.  She lives with her husband and daughter in the city of Ventanas, within the Los Rios province.

She is a member of the La Victoria communal bank, located in the Recinto wetlands, part of the Ventanas settlement.  The people here are farmers and raise livestock.

Roxana Eloisa raises corn and rice and makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy weed killers, urea, fertilizers, and insecticides.

She will invest the money from the loan into farming.  Her dream is to have another business so that she can have another income.  Her challenges are crop plagues and disease.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Martha Liliana

texts.es: En su credikiva pasado Martha compró juguetearía y ropa para atender la temporada de fin de año y ganó dinero el cual reconvirtió aumentando su capacidad de compra y su capital de trabajo. En la actualidad programó el crédito para el mismo mes del año anterior y comprará juguetearía y ropa en mayor volumen,  pues conoce bien su mercado sus proveedores la esperan para hacerle buenos descuentos y ganará una vez mas,  dinero con el cual beneficiará a su familia. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus finaciadores de Kiva: " Estoy feliz, por la ayuda recibida. Mi negocio y toda mi familia nos hemos beneficiado . Muchas Gracias de todo Corazón.
texts.en: Martha used her Kiva loan to buy toys and clothing to be able to handle the year end season and she earned money which she used to increase her purchasing power and working capital.  She planned the loan for the same month last year and will buy toys and clothing in quantity.  She knows her market well and her suppliers wait for her to give her good discounts so that she will earn more money to benefit her family.  She sends the following message to the Kiva lenders,” I’m happy for the help you have given me.  My business and my entire family have benefitted.  Thank you very much will all of my heart.”

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ubay, Bohol. Concepcion earns a living through her food vending business. She sells home-cooked foods to the people in her place. She is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for food vending such as sugar, flour, margarine, and cooking oil. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more to the people thus augmenting her income and profit. In the future, Concepcion hopes of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for food vending such as sugar, flour, margarine, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Hawa O.

texts.en:
This is 60-year-old Hawa O. She is married with eight adult children. In 1980, Hawa O. established her food stall. She started it because she did not go to school, and her parents were traders who trained her in their business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000 in order to purchase cake flour - 5 bags @ Le150,000, sugar - 4 bags @ Le250,000, vegetable oil - 5 rubbers @ Le150,000, eggs - 5 cartons @ Le320,000, couscous (wheat) - 2 cartons @ Le200,000. In the future, Hawa O. plans to expand her business and save enough money for her retirement. The rainy season is a major problem. She is hardworking and needs enough capital to buy more stock in order to yield profit. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy eggs, Maggie, and tomato ketchup for her food stall.

loans.name: Carlos Dario

texts.es: Cuando Carlos y su esposa hace 4 años,  quedaron desempleados y sin ingresos, debieron buscar alternativas para responder a los gastos de su  hogar, en el que existen 3 hijos en las edades de 8 a 10 años;  Inicialmente compraron un plan de celulares y decidieron vender minutos en su barrio a los vecinos, que se trasladaban a lugares no muy cercanos para lograr comunicarse. Con este negocio y  observando su mercado le surgió la idea de alquilar lavadoras, para que las familias satisfacieran las necesidades de mantener limpia la ropa  del hogar, con menos esfuerzos y sobre todo resguardados del candente sol de Caribe.  Carlos atiende si negocio desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y de lunes a domingos, con el fin de hacerlo crecer y aumentar sus ingresos, para beneficiar cada vez más a su familia. El servicio de alquiler de máquinas lo realiza vía telefónica  la solicitud y el envía sus lavadoras donde la necesiten, para posteriormente ir por ellas de acuerdo a las horas pactadas en la solicitud. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante  el cual  adquirirá  planes ofrecidos por operadores de teléfonos y comprará más lavadoras, debido a que su clientela se ha incrementado y  muchos de ellos no pueden acceder al servicio, porque se  las maquinarias estas alquiladas cuando lo requieren , perdiendo así posibilidades de aumentar sus ingresos y ganar un poco más. Su sueño de prosperidad es tener su propia casa y fortalecer su negocio cada vez más, pues sabe que apuntándole a su crecimiento muchas de sus metas son probables de lograr.
texts.en:
When Carlos and his wife became unemployed and without an income four years ago, they decided to look for alternatives to pay the household expenses, where they have three children, from ages eight to ten.  Initially they bought a cellular plan and decided to sell minutes to their neighbors who would travel to faraway places and wanted to be able to communicate.  With this business, and by watching their market, they got the idea to rent our washing machines so that families could have the means to wash clothing in their homes.

Carlos tends to his business from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm, Monday to Friday.  He wants to grow it and increase his income in order to benefit his family.  He provides his rental services via telephone and he sends his washers to where they are needed and picks them up in accordance with the number of hours agreed to.  He is asking for a Kiva loan, his first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will acquire plans offered by phone service providers.  He will also buy more washing machines, because his number of customers is increasing and many of them can’t access the service because the machines are rented out when they need them.  He loses the opportunity to increase his revenue and earn a little more.  His dream of prosperity includes having a home of his own and strengthening the business.  He knows that by focusing on growth, many of his goals are within reach.

loans.use: to buy washing machines.

loans.name: Gibrilla  S.

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Gibrilla. He is married and has two children, ages seven and one. One is a school-going child. In 2009, Gibrilla established his clothing business, which sells jeans, shirts, polos, Lacoste, crepe, coats and other items. He began his business because he dropped out of school at Form V because of lack of sponsorship. His mother-in-law gave him some money to start business, and the business has grown from a stall to a boutique.  

Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about 2,200,000 Sierra Leonean leone (Le) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Gibrilla has already received and successfully repaid one loan. He now requires a new loan in order to buy jeans (two dozen @ Le 440,000); shoes (12 @ Le 170,000); polos (two dozen @ Le 336,000); and shirts (2 dozens @ Le 420,000).  The balance of Le 68,000 will be used for transportation. 

In the future, Gibrilla plans to build a house, open another outlet, provide quality education for his children, and to become an international businessman.  The loan will help him to accomplish some of his future plans. He is hardworking and honest businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for his business

loans.name: Jaya Ram Group

texts.en:
Mahulpada village in the Bolangir district of Odisha, India is a remotely located rural village. In this village, there is a separate hamlet called the Mahar community. The main source of livelihood of this community is weaving bamboo baskets. In the year 2010, six poor, illiterate rural women of this hamlet formed a Joint Liability Group named Jaya Ram with the objective of taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the overall development of their family and the improvement of their existing businesses. Basanta, about 43 years old, is the featured member who is sitting in the middle with her hand raised. She is married and resides in a small hut with her husband, one son age 15 and one daughter age 12. Her children are continuing their studies. All members of this group belong to a very poor background far away from all basic needs like education, shelter, health facilities etc.  

The business of Basanta (weaving bamboo baskets) is a traditional business in her community. Basanta and her husband do the processing work and weave baskets of different shapes and sizes. They sell their products in the nearest weekly market in their town. Some traders also regularly come to this village to purchase bamboo products. Basanta earns a monthly profit of Rs 2,000/- from her business. As there is a growing demand for these products to supply to various parts of the country, Basanta wants to purchase more raw bamboo with this loan amount to work for a longer period without any interruption for more output. This will help her to earn some extra income to manage the family smoothly. Basanta hopes to construct a house in the near future.

The other five members of the group are Udia, Sushama, Balamati, Tarulata and Subidha who are doing similar businesses.

loans.use: To purchase raw bamboo

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, Rugiatu earns about 2,980,000 Sierra Leonean leone (Le) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Rugiatu has already received and successfully repaid three loans. She now requires a new loan in order to purchase mayonnaise (three cartons @ Le 400,000); eggs (three cartons @ Le 280,000); garri (five bags @ Le 140,000); vegetable oil (five rubbers @ Le 280,000); and ketchup (three cartons @ Le 340,000). The balance (Le 40,000) will be used for transportation. 

In the future, Rugiatu plans to build a house, educate her child, and open a restaurant. The loan will help her to achieve some of her future plans. She is hardworking and trustworthy. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy vegetable oil, garri (cassava flakes), eggs, ketchup, spaghetti and mayonnaise, and to pay laborers to transport the goods.

loans.name: Crisologo

texts.en: Crisologo is a 47-year-old fisherman from Ubay, Bohol. He is a father of nine children. Crisologo has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. Crisologo is a asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, hooks, buckets, and fuel for the boat. With this, he will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Crisologo dreams of improving his business. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, hooks, buckets, and fuel for the boat for his fishing business.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
This is Jorge; he previously accessed a PHP 15,000 loan that he utilized to purchase more sacks of rice. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another PHP 22,000 loan. He will be utilizing this loan to buy more sacks of rice. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jorge hopes to expand his business and dreams to have good health. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more sacks of rice needed in his business.

loans.name: Osman  Malam

texts.en: This is 59-year-old Osman Malam. He is married, and has seven children aged 29, 28, 26, 19, 11, 9, and 6 years. Three are school-going children. In 2008, Osman Malam established his bags (school bags, traveling bags, casual bags) business. He began his business because as a teenager he was farming with his parents in the village because of his poor background; he was not fortunate enough to attend school. When he grew older, he decided to start a petty trading business. His father wanted him to be a farmer, but he had to leave the village for the main town because farming does not yield any profit. He was dealing local produce. In 2008, he changed his business into bags. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 606,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Osman Malam has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy school bags - 50 pieces @ Le25,000, traveling bags - 50 pieces @ Le35,000, casual bags - 30 pieces @ Le15,000, and computer bags - 15 pieces @ Le70,000. In the future, Osman Malam hopes to sponsor his children's education. The loan will help as it is the source of income. The rainy season is a problem as it reduces sales. He is hard working. He has successfully paid the previous loan and he will make sure he repays this loan in order to acquire subsequent loans. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags for his consumer goods business.

loans.name: Jaya Laxman Group

texts.en:
Five poor, illiterate, rural women of Mahulpada village in the Titilagarh Block of the Bolangir district of Odisha, India formed a Joint Liability Group named Jaya Laxman in the year 2010 with the objective of supporting their traditional business of bamboo basket weaving by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the overall development of their family. Manju, about 36 years old, is sitting on the extreme left with her hand raised. She hails from the Mahar community. This community does bamboo weaving work. Manju is married and resides in a small mud house with her six family members: her husband, three sons (19, 15 and 5 years old) and one daughter (10 years old). All members of this group are below the poverty line. The Mahar community to which Manju belongs, has a separate hamlet in her village.  

Manju runs a business weaving bamboo baskets, which is the traditional business of her community. Manju and her family do the processing work and weaving of baskets like “kula, tupa, kurli, bhuga, kulei, garna, talei, parla etc." in different sizes. During the marriage season, there is a heavy demand for these products. They sell the products once a week in the weekly market in the nearby town. Some traders also regularly come to this village to purchase bamboo products. Manju earns a monthly profit of Rs 2,500/- from her business. To meet the growing demand for these products, Manju wants to purchase more raw bamboo with his loan to work for a longer period without any interruption. She also wants to procure some ready-made products from other weavers. This will help her to earn some extra income to bear the regular expenses of her family in a smooth manner and to materialize her future hope of constructing a house.

The other four members of the group are Nira, Pushpa, Baidehi and Lalita who are doing similar businesses.

loans.use: To purchase raw bamboo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more local food stuffs for her business.

loans.name: Aminata Issa

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Aminata. She is divorced, and has four children who are 10, 14, 16, and 19 years old. In 1996, Aminata established her cosmetics, toiletries, baby clothing, and jewels business. She began her business because she learned from her mother. She used to help her mother after school hours by selling in the market. She later began her own little business, and now this business is the main source of her income for the support of her children. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase wax cotton - 20 pieces @ Le 80,000, body spray - 10 dozen @ Le 50,000, bio-clear body cream - 40 pieces @ Le 10,000, gel - 10 dozen @ Le 50,000, earrings - 10 dozen @ Le 50,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Aminata hopes to build a house and improve her business in order to support her children's education. Rise in transportation costs and the inflation rate are her major business challenges. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase wax cotton - 20 pieces @ Le 80,000, body spray - 10 dozen @ Le 50,000, bio-clear body cream - 40 pieces @ Le 10,000, gel - 10 dozen @ Le 50,000, and earrings - 10 dozen @ Le 50,000.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Group

texts.en:
The name of this Joint Liability Group is Maa Santoshi. It consists of four active women. All the entrepreneurs of this group belong to Bhawanipatna town in the Kalahandi district in Odisha, India. Sabita, standing on the extreme left in a yellow sari in the photo, is one of the members of this group. She is 40 years of age and lives with her husband, one daughter (20 years old) and one son (22 years old). Her family migrated to this area 30 years ago to maintain their livelihood. 

Sabita has been running a grocery store along with a small restaurant attached to it for the last 15 years with the help of her husband. Both the wife and husband manage the business. To manage the restaurant, she has engaged three workers whom she pays 10,000 INR per month. Sabita earns a net monthly profit of 8,000 INR from the business. It is difficult on her part to manage the household as well as business expenses. Sabita has a desire to increase her income by adding some value-added items to her existing business. She wants to purchase a refrigerator for the grocery store for keeping soft drinks and she wants to repair the restaurant shed with the loan. Sabita has a dream of establishing herself as a proud owner of a quality restaurant and marrying her daughter in a respectable manner.  
 
The other three members of her group. Kuni, Manju and Budhamani, are running a tire reselling centre and barber shops.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and make repairs to her restaurant

loans.name: Eroolthuu

texts.en: Mr.Eroolthuu is 33-years-old lives with his wife and two sons in a small house in Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife Ganchimeg, aged 33, works with her husband with transportation service business in the Russian and Mongolian boarder town. His son, Togoldor, goes to local school, and his younger son, Javhlantogs, goes to the local kindergarten. He and his wife have been running this business of transportation service in that town since 2005. They have already built closer relationships with suppliers in the Russian town. They also connect new businesses to Russian wholesalers. Mr.Eroolthuu has just built new house for his family's use and is asking for MNT 3,000,000 loan to install heating system and insulation. He is a responsible, well-organized, and hardworking person.

loans.use: to install heating system and insulation in his newly built house for his family.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 48, resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is single and she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Lolita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, beverages and piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Lolita hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used handbags, schoolbags, and traveling bags for his retail business.

loans.name: Ruksana-A Group

texts.en:
Nashaba has formed a Joint Liability Group named Ruksana-A in Bhawanipatna town in the Kalahandi district in Odisha, India. Almost all the members of this group belong to a minority category and are below the poverty line. The lady standing on the extreme right in the photograph is Nashaba.She is 45 years old and resides with her husband, one son and one daughter.

Nashaba is running a ready-made clothing shop in the heart of the town. It has been running successfully with the help of her husband for the last 10 years. Her son also helps in her business at times. Nashaba’s husband purchases ready-made garments from a wholesale market 700 kms. away i.e. Kolkata.
