She earns a monthly income of 10,000 INR from her business, which is insufficient to maintain her family and to give proper education to her grown up children. With this background, she has decided to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to purchase some ready-made garments in a lot, which will save her time, money and energy and contribute some profit to her business. Nashaba has long cherished to construct a house of her own and give a technical education to her children.   

The other three members of her group are Ruksena, Najanin and Kusum, who are running an auto repairing centre, a cloth business and a tea and betel nut sho,p respectively.

loans.use: To purchase ready-made garments

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria, 63, resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is a mother and lives with her children to help them manage their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, beverages, and piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells palm sized rugs for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maria hopes to have the strength to continue working because she doesn’t want to depend on her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her general store.

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en: Batsuuri, 52 years old, lives with his wife and niece in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter has passed away so he and his wife care for her child. He has been running a candy and sweets business since 1998 at a local market. He takes his goods from wholesale food centers. Also he has retired from the police organization and gets a pension. Due to diabetes, his left leg has been replaced with an artificial leg, but he has still difficulty walking and uses a crutch. He is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase an automobile which runs on electricity and emits less smoke. As winter comes to Mongolia, the air in Ulaanbaatar is greatly polluted and encouraging the usage of environmentally friendly cars is essential in reducing air pollution. Issuing this loan to the borrower means he can work enthusiastically and also more importantly it will contribute to environmental protection.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile which runs on electricity

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
This is Nemia, 43, resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Bienvenido, a driver and a father to her children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nemia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, beverages, and  piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nemia hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her general store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
This is Albina; she previously accessed a PHP 25,000 loan that she used to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 loan to buy different products such as belts, towels, umbrellas, flashlights, hammers, and other products needed in her general merchandise store. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

Albina hopes that all her children will finish their studies and dreams to expand her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of supplies and products needed in her home products business.

loans.name: Ruksana-B Group

texts.en:
Ruksana-B is a Joint Liability Group formed by four active women from Bhawanipatna town in the Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. Kanak, sitting on the extreme left wearing a sky colored sari and holding turmeric powder, is the featured member. She is 29 years of age and lives with her husband and one daughter who is three years old.

Kanak is running a unit processing forest produce like turmeric, arrowroot, honey, mustard and jhuna. Her husband helps in her business and collects the forest produce from different places in the state and outside the state. After collection, Kanak processes the raw products, makes packets and supplies them to the retailers. She has also tied her business with a govt.agency called ORMAS and sold them at a lump sum for a high margin of profit. Her husband also used to go to different district and state level festivals where there is a congregation of persons to purchase her finished products by hiring a stall. Her monthly net income from the processing unit is around 12,000 INR.There is a heavy demand for her products but due to lack of funds, she could not meet the demands of the market. So with the present loan, Kanak planned to procure a bulk quantity of forest products for processing and selling in the market to earn more profit. She has a dream of providing better education to her child and constructing a house of her own in due course.  
 
The other three members of her group are Hasina, Gitanjali and Snehalata. They are running a cloth business, an auto repair center and a Tiffin hotel, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase turmeric, honey, arrowroot etc.

loans.name: Ernesa

texts.en:
This is Ernesa. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy raw ingredients and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy ingredients like rice, beef, pork, chicken and condiments and utensils like spoons, chopping boards, knives, pans and casseroles needed in her growing business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ernesa simply dreams of having a happy family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients like rice, beef, pork, chicken and condiments and utensils like spoons, chopping boards, knives, pans and casseroles needed in her business.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en: Narangerel is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Ger in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. His wife Ganzul, age 28, helps her husband and stays home taking care of their two sons. His son Bilguun, age 11, goes to a local school and son Naranzul, age 2, stays home. He has been running his  retail clothes business in a local market since 2005. He has already built a strong relationship with his customers and suppliers. He imports inventory from China once or twice a month. He needs a car to reduce his transportation service expense by purchasing a car which is also an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming one. He is now requesting 5,250,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car for both business and family use. He is a hardworking, communicative and responsible person.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car for both business and family use

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah, a 40-year-old married woman, and her husband are supporting seven family members. To help improve their living conditions, Najah used to make pastries by order. Later, she began making trays and some decoration pieces from hay and sackcloth. She applied for this loan to buy some raw materials like hay, glue, and others to increase her productivity and therefore increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy some raw materials such as hay, glue etc...

loans.name: Kairkul

texts.ru: Каиркул 58 год, разведена, воспитывает четверых детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, в 1997 году Каиркул начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На сегодня в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 3 дойные коровы, 12 овец и 23 козы. Т В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Каиркул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров . Доходы Каиркул планирует вложить в увеличение своего хозяйства и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Kairkul is 58 years old, divorced, and has four children.  As a source of income for her family, in 1997 Kairkul began a business in animal husbandry.  Having started with 5,000 som (KGS), today her farm brings in about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and dairy products.  Today,  she has three milk cows, 12 sheep, and 23 goats on her farm.  

With the goal of further deveoloping her business, Kairkul applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of two cows.  Kairkul is planning to invest the income in enlarging her business and improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 2 milk cows

loans.name: Fareeda's Group

texts.en:
Fareeda is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Pakistan with her husband, two sons and two daughters. Her husband is jobless, both of the daughters are married, and a son works as a salesman. 

Fareeda herself has been running a beauty salon for two years which is a very successful business for her family. Currently she is in need of purchasing some cosmetic products for her beauty salon. For that as a member of a seven-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cosmetic products like lipsticks, facial creams, makeup kits etc.

With the profits, she will first pay back her loan to Kiva, and then she will purchase a variety of cosmetic products for the salon. 

Fareeda’s dream is to open a new beauty parlor and to get good profits from that, so that she can provide a better future to her children. She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products like facial creams,  lipsticks and makup kits etc for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Nazi's Group

texts.en:
Ms. Nazi is a 35-year-old woman and a mother of three children. Her husband lives abroad and all of the children are students. 

Nazi is very talented and excels in the work of sewing clothes. Since 2009, she has been operating a tailoring business at her home. In this way she manages to provide for her children. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she needs to purchase a new tailoring machine. But due to the lack of money, she is unable to purchase it. 

Therefore, as a member of seven-person lending group, Nazi has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to cover the cost of purchasing a new tailoring machine. In this way, she will be able to complete the orders on time. 

Nazi intends to utilize part of the profits on the betterment of her family members and on providing quality education to her children.

Note: In the picture Nazi holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Bacha

texts.ru: Бача 44 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей - школьников. Бача работает в школьной учительницей в школе села Ак-Суу и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS) 15 лет назад. Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Бача сумела развить свой бизнес с хозяйством, насчитывающим 2 коров с приплодом, 5 голов овец и ежемесячным доходом около 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бача обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скот для откорма. Доходы от кредита Бача планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса, а в будущем мечтает купить машину для семьи.
texts.en:
Bacha is 44 years old, married and has two school-age children.  Bacha works as a school teacher in the village of Ak-Suu and, as a source of additional income for her family, she has a business in animal husbandry and farming.  She started this business with 10,000 som (KGS) 15 years ago.  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Bacha was able to develop her business and now has two cows and their young, and five sheep, which bring in a monthly income of about 7,000 som (KGS).  

With the goal of further developing her business, Bacha applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional cattle to fatten for resale.  Bacha plans to invest the income from the loan in the develpment of her business, and she dreams of one day buying a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.ru: Анварчон житель города Исфара. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Жена Анварчона домохозяйка. Анварчон занимается торговлей. Он арендует магазин, где продает стройматериалы. Торговлей Анварчон занимается 20 лет. Он берет кредит для покупки стройматериалов с целью увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Anvarjon is a resident of the city of Isfara.  He is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  Anvarjon's wife is a homemaker.  Anvarjon is in the building supplies business, selling from a rented store.  Anvarjon has been in business for 20 years.  With the goal of increasing his assortment of goods, he is taking out a loan to buy building supplies.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 64 years old and is married. She has 5 children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. 
She has run a general store in her house for 8 years. She sells milk, beverages, stationery, confectionery and she intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.
She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her family's emergencies.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

loans.name: Elva

texts.en:
Elva is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Bohol, Philippines. She has engaged in a hog raising business for more than 10 years now.
Elva is asking for a loan to buy feed and food supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to grow and produce healthy pigs.
Elva hopes of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and food supplements for the pigs.

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Binh is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food to sell from her stall. Binh's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of higher quality food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Quoc

texts.en:
Quoc is 39 years old and married with two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn an income by running a food stall to sell meals for breakfast to people in their community. 
He started this activity 12 years ago. He is requesting a loan to expand his business, by buying a greater variety of food and quality ingredients, to make different kinds of meals to sell at his stall and better satisfy his customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of food and good ingredients to make meals for selling.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is 40 years old and married with two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband earns money by selling spare parts for vehicles. Thao has been running a general store in front of her house for 10 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 
Thao is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock in her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that with the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in the future.

loans.use: to buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock in her store.

loans.name: Amarbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Amarbaatar is 48 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a manager in a private construction company for the last five years. His wife works as a stylist at the same company when workload is high. He has begun building his own house but due to finances hasn’t completed it. As winter come to Mongolia, the family is in urgent need to complete and insulate the house. So he is requesting a loan of 5000000 MNT to buy construction and insulating materials. As a result, the family can live in a warm and comfortable place and will also burn less coal.  A decrease in consumption of coal has positive impacts on efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy construction and insulating materials to finish the family house before winter.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang would like to take another loan to buy a greater quantity of soft drinks and coffee to sell from his cafe. His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of soft drinks and coffee.

loans.name: Fakhridin

texts.ru: Фахридин проживает в городе Исфара. Он женатый 36 - летный мужчина. Фахридин является отцом четверых детей. Он занимается купле - продажей сухофруктов. В основном на протяжении пятнадцати лет Фахридин занимается торговлей кураги. В этой области он имеет богатый опыт. Сейчас Фахридин берет кредит для покупки других видов сухофруктов, чтобы расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Fakhridin lives in the city of Isfara. He is a married 36-year-old man, and a father of four children. Fakhridin buys and resells dried fruits. Over the past fifteen years, he has been mainly trading in dried apricots, and has acquired a wealth of experience in this area. Fakhridin is taking this loan to purchase other types of dried fruits in order to expand his business activity.

loans.use: to purchase various kinds of dried fruits

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai would like to take a further loan to buy pork to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in her current business by purchasing pork for resale.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 47-year-old married man and father of five children from Ubay, Bohol. Felix has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 20 years now.
Felix is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, and fuel for the boat. With this, he will be able to enhance his catch thus allowing him to sell more fish at the market.
Felix dreams of improving his fishing business in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.ru: Маруф молодой и энергичный человек с большими планами будущим. Ему 26 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Он очень любит свою семью и старается обеспечить их с лучшим условием проживания. С целью получения дохода и обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами уже несколько лет он работает в авто колоне. Так как он хорошо воспитанный благодаря его родителям, его коллеги очень любят и уважают его. Маруф старается из-за всех сил, чтобы получить больше дохода. Однако его доход не позволяет для покупки всех не обходимых средства для проживания.  Данное время у него нет сбережения для покупки угля и дров для зимовки. Если он не будет покупать угль и дров, то в его доме будет невозможно проводить зиму из-за холода. Его дети маленькие и очень быстро простуживаются. Маруф запрашивает займ на сумму 2200 сомони для покупки угля и дров. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Maruf is an energetic young man with big plans for the future.  He is 26 years old, married, and has two children.  He loves his family very much and tries to provide them with all the best living conditions.  In an effort to earn an income and to provide his family with all the necessitites, he has worked for several years now as a long-haul driver.  Since he is good mannered, thanks to his parents, his colleagues like and respect him very much.  Maruf tries as hard as he can to earn more money.  Nonetheless, his income isn't enough to purchase everything necessary for living.  

At the present time, he doesn't have any savings for buying coal and wood for the winter.  If he doesn't buy coal and wood, the cold will make it impossible for them to make through the winter in their home.  His children are small and they get sick very easily.  Maruf is requesting a loan of 2,200 somoni to buy coal and wood.  He is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy coal and wood for using in winter

loans.name: Davlatoy

texts.ru: Давлатой 39 лет. Она очень заботливая мать и старается обеспечить своих 2 детей хорошим условием проживания. С целью получения дохода, несколько лет назад она уехала в Российскую Федерацию, но она не смогла найти подходящею работу и вернулась на родину. Возвратившись на родину, она поступила на работу в ферме. Уже 6 месяцев как она работает дояркой и успешно справляется со своей работой. Она хочет купить корову и обеспечить своих детей молоком, но ее зарплата не хватает для покупки коровы. Ее дети очень обрадовались, когда узнали о плане Давлатой, купить корову. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки коровы. Давалатой является повторной клиенткой и обещает погасить займ во время. Это займ поможет Давлатой улучшить питание детей и таким образом вырастить их здоровыми. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Davlatoy is 39 years old. She is a very caring mother and tries to provide good living conditions for her 2 children. Several years ago, Davlatoy went to Russia in order to earn a living, but was unable to find suitable work and returned home, where she found work at a farm. For the past 6 months, she has been milking cows and capably taking care of all her work responsibilities.

Davlatoy would like to have a cow of her own in order to provide her children with fresh milk. Her children were very happy to hear their mother's plan. However, Davlatoy's salary is insufficient for such a purchase, and so she is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to buy a cow. Davlatoy is a return client of IMON International, and promises to repay her loan on time. This loan will help her to improve her children's nutrition and ensure their healthy growth. Davlatoy is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is 41 years old, and married with two children. Her husband earns money as a laborer for hire. She supports her family by sewing clothes and other products. She started this business twenty years ago to cover her expenses, and raise her two children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.
Tam is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better quality sewing materials and fabric that she will use to increase the turnover of her business. 
She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials and fabric.
